review_data.review_title: One of best Indian restaurant in Europe
review_data.review: I have been traveling to many cities of the world and can vouch that this is one of the best Indian food in the world. Run by two brothers from Punjab India, you can taste their hospitality in the taste of food. Not to be missed if you are in Prague and like authentic Indian food.
Good and healthy food. Coming here to enjoy lunch with 2 of my friends. It is a busy restaurant. You come, then choose your own poke ^^! Enjoy and definitely come back.

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Elegant, clean with good service. The food was not up to these standards.
review_data.review: We found Gazebo via Google's listings and it had good reviews. Everyone else inside the restaurant was Indian/Asian. We had very high expectations. The place was beautiful and every detail was looked after in an excellent manner. If you take friends, clients or a date, they will like the ambiance. Parking was a little tough but that's a Dubai issue.  Finally comes the food. It was a mixed bag. The appetizers were above average. The Beryani was pretty good. The rest of the food was average and the Hamour fish was below average. I grew up in Dubai and have had Indian food in many cities around the world. The food here is nothing special. Very unfortunate as it was one of very few restaurants we were able to try during our trip to Dubai and we didn't expect a well appointed restaurant with Indian food in competitive Dubai to have average food.  You can get an idea of pricing from the attached image. The prices, for an American consumer, were very reasonable. Total for 4 people was around $70 (255 AED).

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Las Canas is on the edge of the theatre district in Buenos Aires. I found it on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed! They serve pasta, seafood and steak. On the advice of Diego I chose a pasta dish that was superb, assisted by a lovely Argentinean Malbec it made a very complete meal. Nice ambience, very reasonable prices and excellent service. Ask for Juan or Diego. Highly recommended, another top restaurant in Buenos Aires.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: One of the best italian meals ever eaten. Brilliant lication, friendly staff and superb food. A true gem just around a few corners from old town square. Well worth a visit for an amazing time

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker

review_data.review: We found this restaurant on trip adviser and thought we would give it a go as it sounded different. It certainly was ! The food was good and the service was great. Our waiter Mr Bora was super fun and an excellent staff member for the restaurant . We totally recommend going the dancing if great and a real culture experience. Go and enjoy !

One of the best restaurants we visited during our vacation. Nice view over Hanoi, very good food, cool and relaxed atmosphere, but most of all an extremely friendly and helpful staff! Thanks to all, but mostly to our special friend Chucc Chucc!

We accepted gladly the suggested set menu. Excellent tastes and presentation, very pleasantly served by the professional staff. Contents of all courses were thoroughly explained, and even allergies were well handled. Definately recommended!

review_data.review_title: Les Apôtres de Pigalle is Nice!
review_data.review: This place is nice! Les Apôtres de Pigalle has a nice staff and they greet you with a very nice and tasteful shot.  The food is great you will enjoy it! It’s also in the res light district, so great for dinner and a show afterwards at the Moulin Rouge which is 1 block down the street.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: It was raining on a Friday morning, so we needed somewhere inside and out of the wet. We walked past Sto and it just looked very inviting. We were greeted by Jorge who was so welcoming and friendly. We decided to all go or the Lisbon brunch, and boy was that a great decision. The cheese toasty was amazing, as was the pastel de nata. It was all presented so well and is definitely worth a visit. we tried to go again on Monday, only for it to be closed. Jorge was inside cleaning !

a luxurious Indian restaurant is located in the hotel. we came for brunch and gorged ourselves on appetizers. a lot of food. we tried almost everything. If you want to try something new, tasty and unusual, then this is the right place for you. Also great bourbon cocktails. for dessert was Indian teramisu and much more. in short very tasty  роскошный индийский ресторан расположен в отеле. мы пришли на бранч и обьелись еще на закусках. очень много еды. мы попррбовали практически все. если вы хотите попробовать что то новое, вкусное и необычное, то вам точно сюда. еще классные коктейли с бурбоном. на десерт был индийский терамису и еще много всего. короче очень вкусно

Very pleasant place, fully booked on Friday, after 12 you won’t be able to talk due to club loud music like Macarena, 50 cent, 20’ hits, Arabic songs, but you can dance and hang out. Audience 32+. There are few Europeans, most local. Nice Italian vine. Stuff is very attentive, thanks to Ace

It’s the best place for dates, ladies nights of just having cocktails with friends. Amazing view on Burj Kalifa, open area but at the same time restaurant hold a normal temperature for guests, so we have: 1) pleasant atmosphere 2) view on town 3) sneaks like fresh fries with truffle souse, salmon sashimi and good quality cocktails big portions

Came here last Saturday for a birthday meal, staying nearby for a weekend in London. After a little trouble actually finding the restaurant (it isn’t well signed, only a name on the window) we enjoyed a lovely meal. Good service, lovely food, lots of choice. Friendly staff. Seemed very popular especially with takeaways.

review_data.review_title: Very scenic spot for a drink
review_data.review: We didn't eat here but spent most evenings having a cocktail overlooking the beautiful reflection pool and out to the Anderman sea to watch the sunset. Very polite and attentive staff. Great hammocks, tastefully done, Lange comfortable chairs and lounges to recline in, very tropical, very relaxing. Great spot to view the bi weekly fire show.

review_data.review_title: Rare location to eat, best steak ever!
review_data.review: Both of us had 30 day aged steaks with 4 sides of vegetables and sauces plus a bottle of Yarra valley (Victorian) cab sav which complimented a sensationally rich meal. Expensive by Balinese standards but outstanding in every way. Outstanding kitchen, service, management, ambiance and set up. Service was top notch and dessert were large but first class as well. Overall an outstanding experience and a new experience for us after may visits to Bali. If you can afford at least $100AUD a head to get the best steak ever, it’s worth the effort. Highly recommend.

Wow! A small vegan restaurant that feels like you’ve been welcomed into a Vietnamese home. The food was delicious (possibly the best tofu I’ve ever had) with several vegan alternatives to meat and fish.  I can’t recommend this place enough! Definitely a must visit for any vegan or veggie lover!
Staff were amazing. Food top quality. Highly recommend. The sea bass was our favourite which came out in a flaming bowl.

review_data.review_title: Service with warmth and amazing food
review_data.review: Super food and super service ...Juli you made our visit memorable. The salmon roll was gorgeous and the ambience also but the service made this dinner awesome.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Housed in the swanky Park Hyatt Vendome, this restaurant is on the lobby level. They have 3 choices for dinner - 2 degustations and a la carte. I opted for the 6 course degustation. 3 amuse bousche came first and they were ok. The 1st course was white asparagus. Not a big fan, but it was ok. Seabass followed and it was good and well coordinated with all the other elements. Veal was the main and it was very good. A heavy melted cheese course followed. It was ok but too heavy and cheesy to finish. The strawberry and chocolate desserts finished the set and they were great. Petit fours were also too much for me by then  Service is very good as expected  Pur-fect
The steak and bbq restaurant for W hotels worldwide. Good quality with the great W service and friendliness

This is one of the restaurants at intercontinental park lane where i stayed and apparently from a celebrity chef. Came here for breakfast and it’s nice to be in a fancy restaurant rather than one of those mass market places. Very good quality and service

Couldn't get a reservation at Epicure , Le Bristol and they counter offered a seat at this restaurant, which i took  This restaurant is quite casual so i thought the hotel guests have breakfast here but this is not the case. Evidently not an "IT" restaurant in paris. I was here 7 -830pm on a friday night and the place was only 20% full. I also felt overdressed wearing a suit with bow tie  Had the award winning duck pate and it was good. The pigeon was commendable too, and traditionally presented. I prefer the pigeon i had at Le Mesure a few days ago  Service was good but i had such a great time with the staff at Le Gabriel earlier during lunch this pales slightly

As per previous reviewer, it’s under renovation, but we had their menu and food in the all day restaurant  We had a large variety of dishes over 2 days - steamed fish with lime, satay, beef and vegetable curry were good. Duck curry was odd as the duck was like tempura. Crab omelette was equally off with the crab like tempura too. the red ruby dessert also tasted different, not sure good or bad

We dined here on Friday night and enjoyed a great experience. Excellent food, service and wine. The staff are very attentive and even allowed me to use my limited Italian without laughing at me. It was about $230 for 3 courses and wine but we left feeling like it was certainly worth it A nice restaurant for a special occasion and my wife loved the veal Marsala. Make sure you have a limoncello with dessert.

Wide range of drinks and food including cocktails on the menu. Of note was the lemon, ginger honey tea which was very refreshing - not from a bag!  The food menu has a range of specials ( including blue cod) alongside the usual suspects - curries and noodle dishes. The service was very proficient with each member of staff having a specific role. The food did not take very long at all. Portion wise - satay chicken was 4 skewers and the mini vegetable rolls and tempura was more than enough for two. The mains were a reasonable size and are good value for money. My partner had his usual of yellow curry and you could taste the base ingredients and there were chillies in it, not a common sight in NZ. Both dishes had a good tingle to them and you don't have to ask for a spice level, instead cooked to the level as per the dish.  We didn't book and got a table immediately. They also do take away and have a special $10 menu.  Overall, tasty, good menu and excellent staff.

Quick. Range of fillings. The tacos are made in corn tortillas and are not stodgy. Price wise - around $8 a taco with a saving of around $1 per additional taco that you order. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. Once the tacos arrived there was a choice of three sauces - the hot one was reasonably spicy, which is unusual for NZ. Highly recommend it.
Enjoyed multiple happy hours at the pool bar with Khun Pla and khun Mangpor. Worth a visit if in Mai Khao!

I stayed at the JW Marriott/MVCI for 10 days. I went to the south pool/Blue bar for happy hour several times. Great service. Great happy hour! Khun Pichit and Khun Nook (in the picture) and Khun Pla were fantastic.
Have eaten there 4 times now and have enjoyed it more each time. We've tried most of the items on the menu and have loved literally everything. Very authentic flavours and absolutely delicious food.

Since my last 2 dinners were in Red Bean restaurants (Central and Trendy) and I liked them a lot, I decided to give a try at the Red bean restaurant close to my hotel and was not disappointed at all! Extraordinary good dinner and place! First of all, I enjoyed a lot the music set. Secondly, I enjoyed the Red bean set! :) It was a 5 course menu that included a bruschetta, salmon roll, mushroom soup, roasted duck breast and warm passion fruit cake with vanilla ice cream. It was just amazing! And only 25$! I would not recommend to take the Chardonnay by glass, it is not so good as it could be. I think the place is known by their cocktails, because the barmen were busy all the time and it seems that peope liked their creations judging by woops you hear around. All types of credit cards including AmEx are welcomely accepted.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: The restaurant is a bit out of the beaten track in Hanoi but definitely worth a walk! First of all, it is on the eighth floor. Interesting to see lives of usual people on the streets. The ambience is very calm, relaxing and hasteless. The personnel is extremely friendly and disposing. I ordered a lemongrass chicken, it was marvelous! I'd you prefer a cocktail or mocktail without sugar, say it! I even got a 20% discount on the next bill as an encouragement my comments regarding the restaurant and provided service. I was surprised but my American Express was accepted!.. even without an additional charge from the bank.

Went here with a friend for dinner. The menu is somewhat limited. I got a Caprese Salad to start. It was ok. Tomatoes weren’t the greatest mozzarella was ok.  My friend got cannelloni which was ok nothing to write home about. I got a meat lasagna with béchamel sauce , also nothing to write home about.  Overall the service was excellent. Food eh nothing bad about it but it was just average. Atmosphere is like a NYC pizzeria.

Prague has many cuisines but Indian food certainly ranks up there. This family run eatery is ranked as one of the best, so we decided to give it a try. It was also clear conveniently located to our hotel. The ambiance inside is very charming. The menu is fairly extensive, Lucky our very efficient server was a huge help in deciphering some of the lesser known items. We started with shrimp and a fried spinach appetizers, both were fantastic. For entrees, we sampled a nice cross section of dishes, including shrimp, vegetarian, chicken and lamb. The highlight entree was the “K” special platter with a mixed grill of lamb and chicken cooked in different styles. Several flavors of naan bread rounded out our entrees. Lucky took great care of us throughout the meal and we thought the prices here were reasonable.

Words are not enough to describe the pleasure of dining here. The restaurant is open sided but with a canopy roof, like being in a big tent/marquee. Good lighting, plenty of fans, soft music. I had the fried fish fillet, on a sculptured bed of mash with artfully arranged green mango salad, it came so beautifully presented, like any fine dining restaurant, almost reluctant to mess it up. Hubby had the Jacket Daniel burger with a side of fries, it's definitely a gourmet burger. For dessert, I had the creme brulee, perfectly caramelised crust, creamy smooth custard. Hubby's dark chocolate mousse was also amazing. We loved it so much, before we left, we reserved a table for our last dinner in Phuket. Compliments to the chef, and Yanick as the maitre'd, and attentive waitstaff. This is the perfect place for a special night out. Try the Monaco beer cocktail.

Little Blackwood is a gem of a bar. They a great wine and beer selection and the cocktails look awesome too. The staff are always lovely and friendly and the live music gives it an awesome atmosphere!
We had a wonderful evening at Boutary. Very friendly and attentive staff and the carte blanche tasting menu was perfect. We will come back!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover

review_data.review: We went there on a Saturday night. The place is rather small and in a basement. The neighborhood it lays in doesn't really reflect the inside.  Without a reservation you will be seated in the bar area, the music is rather loud but not a nuisance. If you'd like to dine calm I'd advice to make a reservation.  The staff is helpful, but the door keeper at the entrance isn't like, welcoming.  We ordered a 2 cocktails and some food. The cocktails are nicely presented, but as you'll learn in Morocco lots of alcohol. I felt that the mix of the Aperol Spritz was missing and the taste was overkill by the overkill of Aperol. Bellini isn't as nice as the original, not bad but misses that typical martini taste.  Food, portions are rather small and it's adviced to order a dessert or entree if you have more hunger. The wait time is rather long (+-45 minutes) so calculate that in.  Overall I had a mixed feeling. My appetite was a bit gone by the burning smell of some cocktails and the loud music. Tastes of the food are good, but there are better places in Marrakech where you can eat the same for less money. Cocktails are fine if you can handle the alcohol.  Might had a different experience if I sat in the restaurant part.  Finally, the price. It's comparable to European restaurants. We paid for 2 cocktails and 2 dishes 600 dirhams (around 60 euro)

A small restaurant hidden away in Queenstown Fine dining with great service. Meals are good size. You will not leave hungry Finish the night off with a final drink in the bar upstairs. Love this place.

review_data.review_title: Nice view, good food, OK price
review_data.review: The view of this restaurant is very nice. There was a live singer when we came that was good (Western songs). The food is good, slightly more expensive than usual. Restaurant last order is at 9:30pm and closes at 10pm. The only bad thing I have to say about it is that they turn off the light and start cleaning at 9:45pm to make you leave.

review_data.review_title: Great Dinner with Friends after Auto Show @ Javits Center
review_data.review: We were looking for a nice restaurant to go to for dinner after our visit to the Javits Center and we were pleasantly surprised with this very nice place. A few blocks from the Javits Center it was an oasis in the neighborhood. Very good service from the moment we walked in to the last goodbye at the door, they couldn't have been nicer.  The food was Great, we shared 2 appetizers and we each had a main and the presentation for each dish was wonderfull, the flavors were pleasant and a bit different, but all were great.  All in all we had a fine time.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Perfect place for a family lunch. Great meat quality of the burgers. We take 5 miniburgers with fries . It was great! perfect value for money. The service was TOP, George was so Kind, help and follow us in perfect way.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: We were looking for bar restaurant away from the main tourist zone near the Jardins de Trocerdero and came across this gem. We had been in a sister bar called the Frog and Underground in Grands Boulevards so this new find fitted our needs. We were due to celebrate my partners birthday later at a restaurant near our hotel so we ordered the cheese nachos so our evening appetite wasn’t spoilt. Good choice along with the craft beer too. Staff were very helpful and knowledgable. The beer is brewed on the premises down the stairs in the second bar area.

user_data.user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Thrifty Traveler

review_data.review: Lovely Restaurant within this fabulous Hotel, we've experienced the breakfast,lunch & evening meals and they're all excellent, the flavours in the Thai curries are amazing. All the staff are so friendly & helpful & have made our holiday one to remember especially Toon & Eve who are such lovely girls, thank you for everything..x

We were recently in Hanoi for a birthday trip. We were looking for a place to eat and ran across the Red Bean restaurant, what a pleasant surprise. It was our first trip to Vietnam and were looking for some help in ordering, we allowed our server to order for us. I am sorry I can't remember her name, she did an excellent job and came to our table then the food arrived to show us how to "eat" the food we had ordered. It was a great experience and the food was amazing. We really enjoyed our experience at the Red Bean, I would highly recommend having a meal at the Red Bean.

It's all been said before but having tried all the top "Tripadvisor" scorers, Gia Mas just takes the top spot for me. Restaurant business is a hospitality business and hospitality is what you get along with excellent service food and wine despite the house wine arriving cheesey carafes only surpassed by the purple glasses. My tip, don't cram into the sea side or beach, try the taverna side with the extra space, the view is just as good, and secondly don't miss the after dinner " amuse bouche" particularly if it's the chocolate mouse.

Searched Trip Adviser for restaurants in Marrakesh and decided to try Cuisine de Terroir. We were certainly not disappointed and would recommend this place to any visitor who wishes to taste authentic Moroccan food. Found the restaurant easily even though it’s situated within the Medina. The open interior is basically but comfortably furnished. The staff including the proprietor were all friendly, polite and efficient. English was spoken by all. The food was delicious. We had the tagine of beef, prunes and almonds / very tender and tasty and the chicken pastilla / sweet and fragrant. Moroccan sweets were ordered to complete the meal. The meal was value for money. An excellent choice.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Once more referred to Trip Adviser to recommend restaurants in Marrakesh and was not disappointed with the visit to Dar Chef. The entrance was a bit confusing but once in, there was plenty of comfortable seating. The interior was unusual in structure, possibly a courtyard but now with a covered roof. The staff were all polite, efficient and cheerful. We chose the 3 course menu, excellent value at 80dh per person. The soup was hearty and the main tagine courses were piping hot and tasty. We finished the meal with fruit and mint tea. Would recommend this restaurant to any visitors to the city.

Just love this place..only downside is that it is now so popular you have to book several days in advance, especially for Thurs, Friday and Saturday nights. We just don’t want it to change. The owner is so grounded I hope that won’t be the case and he deserves every success. We visited yet again last Friday and tried the new £20 buffet menu. The tofish we usually love wasn’t available but the owner gave us the most delicious plate of noodles to compensate. The new dishes of guacamole, gazpachio, cashew ‘cheese’ and mung beans did not disappoint. In fact I think this was the best meal we’ve ever had there. Warm welcomes, lovely service, superb food with sublime flavours... but sssssh... don’t want anyone else to discover it!!!! Sadly, too late!!!

Awesome evening and great experience as always. Every time Benga takes care of our table we know we are in good hands. We celebrated birthday and engagement and he made it very special for us. We decided to make it a tradition to come back for birthdays

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Another special meal! We really were craving authentic pasta and were lucky to score a reservation. Terrific food and great service from start to finish. Many places we’ve been to seem to thrive on chaos, but this place seemed very well run and the manager was completely cool. My husband and I shared the Caprese salad, and then we each had a pasta dish. Finished off the dinner with dessert and coffee.  You def need a reservation, but the meal is worth the advanced planning.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler

review_data.review_title: Do not miss this terrific dining experience!
review_data.review: We’ve been in NZ for 10 days and this was one of our top 3 meals: outstanding food coupled with superb service.  Believe them when they say a large plate is good for sharing. We shared a dozen oysters (small plate) and then my husband and I each got a large plate because we like different things. The chicken thigh is def shareable. It came with a veggie medley of fresh peas and chopped zucchini with a lovely mint flavor. DH had the whole baked sole, probably not too much for one person. We did get the peas/broccoli/baby spinach side - very nice substitute for a salad and also shareable.  But the best part was the Pavlova - especially shareable and just to die for.  Public was really busy but our server - actually the entire staff - never missed a beat.  This place is a must if you are in Queenstown.
We enjoyed a great lunch with my 2-years old toddler, Emad was absolutely nice and the food was delicious. Highly recommend (chicken Pastela and vegetarian cous cous).

Loved the atmosphere and the food at Spice Symphony. Great atmosphere. Lively, but not so loud your can't have a nice conversation. Nisar did a great job showing us some fun things on the menu we might have missed.

An echo of other reviews ... getting in to the restaurant is similar to a speakeasy (it looks like a boarded up shop) but the atmosphere inside is excellent. The 18 courses were fantastic, my only complaint is that there is just too much food (I'd ditch a couple of courses ...the bread and one of the shellfish courses). The wine pairings were really great, staff friendly and knowlegable ... An excellent meal, save room for the popcorn ice cream.

review_data.review_title: Amazing experience, super friendly staff and great food
review_data.review: Overall an amazing experience. Located in a beautiful setting in Prague, on the river front, opposite the bridge. All staff spoke impeccable English and were professional and friendly. We ordered a Czech wine, recommended by our server which was excellent, and had a mixture of starters including the gem salad and shrimps. All portion sizes were more than enough for one person. For the mains again a selection of the ribeye steak, Czech 7 hour duck and Octopus. All meals were cooked to perfection. The price was also very good for the level of restaurant. Overall I cannot fault it. It was an amazing experience and we would definitely return. Thank you to all the staff for making it such a great evening, especially with the birthday surprise for my sister in law

review_data.review_title: Reached in search of a vegetarian place in NY!
review_data.review: One of my colleagues was n search of vegetarian food in NY and we ended up reaching here (bough I did not have vegitarian food !).  Overall the food is good, ambience in nice, and location is of course great - easily accesssible from Manhattan.  Little pricey, but I guess that is true for all NY restouraants.

Easy to find thank you trip advisor! Walked in, filled with locals, got to sit at a round table in the back with 2 men who were regulars. How lucky! They helped us navigate the menu and we ended up with the Best Chinese lunch EVER!! Tiny buns aka dumplings with soup inside have spoiled us! The noodles, the Kung pao everything even the tea was the best in New York. And the lovely gentleman sitting with us said he had just returned from Hong Kong and said even there the tiny buns were not as good. High praise!

user_data.user_tags: Like a Local;Shopping Fanatic;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: After a fair amount of stomping around the Old Town, some lunchtime food was necessary, so I followed Lonely Planet's suggestion of this place, for it's views as much as anything else.  It's just a few minutes walk away from the Basilica Cistern and the Hippodrome and accessed through the And Hotel lobby.  When I arrived, there was nobody else in the restaurant, so the service was rapid and attentive. However, the dish I picked from the menu was off and I was steered towards one of the specials instead.  When this arrived, it was fine - a lamb dish - but I didn't much like the bed of sauce and vegetables it was on - but this is probably my problem as I'm not a big fan of vegetables!  The cost was fair and the staff were lovely - but the real draw for this place is the excellent panoramic views it offers.

review_data.review_title: Very good food in patong beach
review_data.review: Delicious foie gras. The pana cotta is so good. The duck. The chef is outstanding. Go check it out, you will enjoy great food.

review_data.review_title: Voucher brought us in and no regrets
review_data.review: We came here because of a Grabone voucher for platter and wine, and we were not disappointed. A small hip bar on the lakefront, but roomy enough to get a seat and table. Platter was generous in size and very tasty with the local cheeses and meats. Staff were friendly. Came as a couple but could easily have come with children earlier in evening as there was a relaxed atmosphere.

We visited V Zatisi for a valentines meal with wine pairing and enjoyed it. I ordered the zatisi degustation and somehow ended up with the Indian one, but by the time I realized it, didn’t want to make a fuss. My son ordered the seasonal degustation and enjoyed it very much. Wine pairings were with generous pours, excellent whites and ok reds. Food presentation was good, Indian courses were tasty, the other courses a bit less flavorful. One star off because one of our dining partners ordered the steak and it was tough, requiring a lot of sawing to cut. Our wait staff were friendly with a great sense of humor, and overall we enjoyed the meal. Not sure we would return, as the price point was a bit high for the food quality.

review_data.review_title: Overated High price ideal for poseurs and Hooray Henrys
review_data.review: Not really a great bar - its OK if you like posing and spending stupid amounts of money on overpriced drinks with pretty poorly trained staff.

review_data.review_title: It was a late night dinner
review_data.review: I had an appointment after a meeting that finished at 8:00 pm and my guest expressed an interest in pasta. I consulted TripAdvisor when I don't have a personal recommendation.  This was a very good choice. We were seated quickly when we arrived (which was 15 minutes late due to the previous event running late). The restaurant was clean and bright. our tabke was "ready to go". I ordered the chicken special, which was very good. My colleague was pleased with the lobster ravioli.  I was most happy with the dessert; Tiramisu. It was great and topped off the meal well.

We had a nice quiet dinner. Fine dinning. Menu is not very large. Khmer and French option. I would recommend to have a nice dinner , out of the crowds in a very nice setting. Very nice presentation and outstanding service.

This was like watching an opera / Orchestra the way the team at the front worked together lead by one of the best maitre d’s that I’ve seen all the staff gliding around the floor taking orders and bringing out the food and drink lead by a master of her craft As for the food WOW the pasta was like eating silk with the richest Ragu the best comfort food ever Thanks so much to Mr Theo Randall for taking the time out for a chat and signing a couple of his cook books for me it really made my birthday All I can say is I can’t wait to come back TOTALLY AMAZING ‍

review_data.review_title: TREAT Your self To the Regional tasting menus 👌out of this world 🌎
review_data.review: Excellent staff 🕺🏻💃sublime food👩‍🍳👨‍🍳 and perfect cocktails 🍸🥂it really doesn’t get much better than this 👌👌😘

review_data.review_title: Best kitchen and front of house team in London with out a doubt 👌👌👌👌👌
review_data.review: I’ve been eating in the top restaurants in London and Europe for coming on for 30 years and I have never come across a more well oiled Team than at Theo’s the core members and you all no who your are are very efficient,polite and extremely knowledgeable from being greeted like a family member to the perfect cocktails to the best wine pairings and definitely some of the best put together menus I’ve had the privilege of eating Thank you all for a lovely Christmas absolutely perfect x

review_data.review_title: Outstanding Italian food at its best 👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👨‍🍳
review_data.review: I’ve been eating here for several months now trying all the different regional menu’s that change each month taking you on a food journey around Italy without having to get on a plane. Just a shame you don’t get the suntan with it But you certainly get the best cocktails and the best value for money for the service,food and drink OUTSTANDING  The À la carte menu has an abundance of good choices they really get the taste buds going and the wine pairings really finish off the dishes to bring out the best . I don’t think you would find any high end restaurant in London that have a really really good core TEAM of people as they do here keep up the good work your all amazing.

This is the third time we’ve eaten at the Rajdoot and we’ll continue coming back again and again. The service is impeccable, there’s a good list of drinks and the food is always incredible. Everything is cooked fresh and you can really tell. We ordered for four and there wasn’t a thing left by the end - everyone was very full and very happy! Plus management offered us a complimentary digestif so it was Tia Maria and Baileys all round before we left. Best king prawn pathia I’ve had in London, and I’ve tried many. Already can’t wait to return!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Managed to squeeze in here last night and it was incredible. Our second time here (first was to see the jazz) and it was great! Have to say that ordering straight from the menu was much better quality than the set menu provided on the jazz night we attended.  My king prawn pathia was one of the best I’ve had before, my sister’s tikka masala was far from boring (tasted flame kissed, like proper tikka should) and the Bombay aloo was delicious too.  All of the curries are really chunky and flavourful - in other curry restaurants the sauces seem like they’ve just puréed all the ingredients then thrown in some onion chunks for texture. The food here is the opposite!  The manager is a really nice guy and is candid about how busy it gets/waiting times etc so you always know where you stand.  Sitara is just a lovely little family-run place with great food. We’ll be back!

review_data.review_title: Very good food and presentation but let down by poor service generally. I did have such high hopes.
review_data.review: After seeing such great reviews this restaurant was on my wife an I's `bucket list' of places to visit. The food was of a very good standard, well cooked and presented very professionally. The wine menu was also well selected and varied. The thing that let this venue down was the poor level of service generally. The lady serving us was appeared confused, did not know what was on the menu (the menu id not particularly lengthy) and paid poor attention to us even though it was fairly empty. Instead both her and her colleague focused on two gentlemen who we assumed were regularly from their conversations. We also waited a very long time after having our plates cleared away before being offered desert. For such a venue and with prices set as they are I would have expected better having dined at a large number of other places in Prague of the same level. My wife and I do not plan on coming back again.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: I’m from Italy (really) and I really like good tasty but not to heavy pizza. Now this is the place! In addition outstanding service, familiar but not extravagant, warm, cordial with cosy and very nicely decorated ambient, ideal for both couples or for family gatherings. Service is perfect and all areas of the restaurant are clean and tidy. You can see that is properly run and always under the control of the owners who wore me welcome you at any occasion.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Super Lamb and super price of $45 also they deliver for $8
review_data.review: Pros: Great value, great food, big portions, friendly folk cons: website doesn't say delivery so you can get it delivered for $8 which is worth it.  1 is enough for 2 people. Seriously. We are hungry guys and massively over ordered but have been enjoying the lamb for a couple of extra days.

review_data.review_title: Perfect place for salads and fresh drinks!
review_data.review: Excellent salads and drinks. Their yogurt ice cream with amareto is super delicious! My favourite is falafel salad. The owner is very attentive and staff is super professional. Totally recommend if you want to make a break of couscous and tagine during your trip in Morocco:)
We went because of the good reviews. It was actually quite ordinary although a nice location in the city.

review_data.review_title: Excellent Restaurant in the heart of Seminyak
review_data.review: Delicious Italian food and cosy atmosphere in this beautiful restaurant in the heart of Seminyak. Highly recommended!

review_data.review_title: Great Food, Great Price, Great Story!
review_data.review: As a small restaurant, I appreciated the willingness to reserve a table for 8. Unfortunately, my sisters-in-law (4) are a noisy lot when together and became engrossed in sharing each other's meals. So, they left with a good taste in their mouths but unaware of the story behind the restaurant. Veg spring rolls, fish amok, and fried chicken were the biggest hits. Service was good and we were blown away by the $42 bill for 8 adults, who drank beer too. Well done, Tevy!

Located a short distance behind the Art Centre Market we ate a great meal here. The service was attentive without being overbearing and we were served promptly and politely. They were able to cope with both a large party of about 12 and a few tables with couples on without the service or standards suffering. We noted that the kitchen staff were wearing hair nets and the kitchen itself was separated from the restaurant area. Good service and good food - what else do you need?

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Small restaurant / café / bar with an ever so friendly lady serving the tables. Go there for delicious Nom Krok (coconut “pancakes”) - delicious!

review_data.review_title: Delicious food, great venue - even better cause
review_data.review: It is like a little oasis by a plain street. I stat outside in the beautiful little garden. The food was delicious. My anyways positive experience was taken one step further, since this lovely restaurant does a lot to support adolescents by offering them an educational training (appreticeship) while providing everything they need. Go there!
Family owned cafe with nice and cheerful Serbian owner. Offers typical German food and Serbian. Nice to spend the evening at home a like diner

review_data.review_title: Did not really hit the spot
review_data.review: We have been to a few of these help the locals learn restaurants over the years and really like supporting them but I am sorry to say this one did not really come up to scratch.  The pickup service failure- they had to be reminded to pick us up after we had been waiting for 30 minutes- this is even after we had sent an email booking(not answered) plus a confirmation call from our hotel reception earlier in the day  Setting was nice and service was friendly - but hard to see who was learning and who was coaching - recently in Laos we went to one where they had T-shirts to show who did what  Unfortunately for the prices charged (high by Cambodian standards) they failed to deliver - especially the $10 prawns and red curry sauce - the 6 very small prawns were soft like crawfish (very disappointing), the red curry sauce was nice but we could of done with some more, red rice was also ok but to call this plate a main is a joke - 6 mouthfuls and it was all over!  We did like the complimentary spring rolls and the mango and sticky rice ($4) was a good rendition of an Asian classic.  We did have a bottle of Italian Pinot Grigio which was unexpectedly very dry and a nice bottle of French Chardonnay both of which were priced at around the $22 mark - not sure who was meant to be coaching the lovely young lady to get the cork out but together we got there in the end  Large Angkor beers around $4 each  Plus a small thing that’s annoying is not showing the fully inclusive prices........
Met with colleagues for dinner. The staff was incredible, the food was amazing and the wine selection/pairing was spot on on. They set aside a great wine for us. We had a great time!
We took buffet menu and it was great, Food was awesome and excellant taste. Dal was excellent, taste was good.
I visited restaurant on lunch time and ordered Paneer kadai and it was excellent. Garlic naan was good. Salted lassi is also good.  i will recommended this restaurant in Prague for vegetarians.

Visited this place on my recent trip to Prague. Located near old town and the restaurant is in the basement. Decent place and we ordered our dishes as well as butter chicken. It tasted nothing like butter chicken and we told the manager about it. I appreciate the fact that they listened to our complain and acknowledged the same. They also took of the charges off our final bill. Other then this everything else was good. Service also has a scope for improvement. Overall I would recommend this place for Indian food.

review_data.review_title: Excellent Italian Restaurant but a bit expensive
review_data.review: After we visited Betlehem Chapel we stopped nearby at Oliva Nera, an Italian restaurant to have some drinks and desserts. We ordered local drinks such as the Staropramen Lezak tmavy and Radler beer which were very good in taste and had ordered home made desserts like the tiramisu and the torta al cioccolato con pistacchi. They were all delicious and we enjoyed our short stay as the weather was great. The staff was very helpful. the price tag of the goods were a bit on the high side but we still recommend this restaurant.

We had already been to quite many good places during our city break in Paris but Au P'tit Curieux turned out to be the crown jewel of this trip. Food just perfect (we had 3 courses of classical French cuisine); great wines that were recommended with expertise by the host; cosy, easy-going ambience. But the best of all: What a devoted and personal service. So glad we found this restaurant. We were really happy after this dinner!
Their pasta's is excellent, Good tasting house wines. Friendly and fast service. My warmest recommendations. Would go back.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Very pleased to select this restaurant for 22 guys. The degustion menu was a treat. The food was excellent and the 1495CZK for it is value for the money. But it's not ok when a waitor smells like an ashtray. And it's not ok not to clean the table of plates before a new dish arrives.

review_data.review_title: Dammar Lounge Fine DIning - The BEST in Siem Reap for fine dining! Don't miss it!
review_data.review: My husband and I recently had dinner at Damak Lounge on two occasions on our past trip to Siem Reap. It’s elegant and very tasteful. A hidden gem in Siem Reap! Perfect decor and a lovely staff. We’ve had dinner here in the past and it was awesome but some menu items have changed and it’s a “must do” if in Siem Reap. You won’t find this quality of dining anywhere else. Upon arrival you are guided by a host and taken by elevator to the second floor - the Privileged Floor by Lotus Blanc where Damak Lounge is located. My husband is on a special diet and they saw to his every need. Kanika our host made our first reservation while explaining all the amenities in the area. The restaurant has an extensive wine list as well as cocktails. I had champagne and it was heavenly. There’s no rush, couples and families at tables chatting and celebrating in a low tone. Extremely top shelf. Last year when we were there they had live music but this time a nice selection of soft music playing. I’m writing my review and wishing we were there now! One night we were pretty tired so we ordered and our meal was delivered to our room. It was perfect. If you want something that’s not on the menu, just tell them, and it will happen. Mr. Jacky suggested Damak Lounge along with a couple other places. But Damak Lounge was a home run! Don’t miss it!

review_data.review_title: Steak ! Steak! Did I mention steak?
review_data.review: Thoroughly enjoyed this adorable restaurant. Family of four.  We ordered two steaks and two salads - typically we have a gigantic appetite for steak and it was a huge amount of food - we suggest you SHARE STEAK AND ONE SALAD MAX PER FOUR PEOPLE.  If you are used to American Caesar salad we suggest passing on this, as their version wasn't what we are used to. Take a look at the other salads as they pass by - very large and deconstructed style. They offer half portions.  The decor of this restaurant was great with drawn on plates by past customers covering the walls and small air planes and toy blimps along the ceilings. It was filled with tourists but we didn't find it "too touristy".  The wait staff were very lovely and kind, spoke English very well.  Our only criticism would be that the food seemed to be rushed - the salad, steaks, and sides all came rushing to the table all at once very quickly overwhelming the table.  Would suggest this to our friends in the future !

review_data.review_title: Family or 'group' type of dining experience
review_data.review: First off warning about inability to find taxis on New Years Eve....UBER transportation suggested by hotel as taxi wait over 90minutes. UBER prices 6-7times higher rates than usual  Arrived on time at 930pm and greeted at bottom of staircase by server who spoke no English but gracious.  Upstairs we ascended to first floor and met other families and guests. Served bubbly wine and hung around WAITING for dinner for an hour. Tasty single appetizer offered for the hour.  1030pm Ascended another flight of stairs to warm/hot small room with basic tables and recorded music.  Served set menu (I believe they do offer vegetarian options) from Nicos' favourite winery I suspect. Not mine unfortunately.  Food was good as were wines - however AS FOODIE and lover of great wines would not have chosen this again as place to spend New Year's Eve. We were asked to use the same wine glasses from one tasting to the next - tacky. Home style cooking and presentation. Some dishes above average in taste - presentation average.  Desserts arrived as the clock struck 12 and we left shortly after.  While I would recommend this as REASONABLY priced wine/dine experience - and the food was good - I DON'T feel this listing deserves to rated number one dining location on TripAdvisor for BA.

Seminyak kitchen is located in Courtyard by Marriott Bali hotel in Seminyak area. I like this restaurant for breakfast. The food menu features many of International dishes, including egg benedict, nasi goreng seminyak, and delectable desserts in sleek modern dining place. The staffs are friendly and helpful to assist you what to choose. Many food variance such as international food, indian, steak and grill food. Over all, Seminyak kitchen is a good place to eat with family and friends. Selamat makan!

We were picked up for dinner by tuk tuk and taken to the restaurant which is in a lush, quiet area away from the busy road. The design of the restaurant is beautiful, it feels like it's sitting amongst the tree tops. The food was fantastic, and delicious. It was a quiet evening and we practically had the place to ourselves as it is low season but it was a magical experience nonetheless. Highly recommend!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We were impressed at the genuine Italian looking and tasting food here. Having been to Italy several times, this restaurant was trying hard to match the genuine experience. Relatively limited menu but would certainly recommend this restaurant. Make sure you book ahead though as we saw several turned away at the door.

My husband invited me to Pur' to celebrate our first anniversary :) The whole experience was delightful from start to finish. We went for the 6-course dinner, which is very generous if you also count the beautiful amuse-bouche sent by the chef (we started with a foie gras lollipop which was divine!!). The bread and wine selection are exquisite, (a wine is associated with every dish), the service is outstanding and the food is mouthwatering. Every course was a beautiful surprise for our palates, and, for the cherry on the top, we met the chef before leaving and he gave us little cookies to take home and eat the next day. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Paris!

review_data.review_title: Its In Our Top 5 (Or Maybe 3) Of All Time
review_data.review: You know you have experienced something special when you are still talking about individual dishes a week later. My wife and I had the pleasure of a 6 course tasting menu on a recent visit to London. Launceston Place had been on our bucket list for a few years.  The service was friendly and engaging.Each member of the team was very knowledgeable and took time to answer any questions we had. Every dish was a taste explosion and it was impossible to choose a favourite. The complex flavours were the result of many processes beyond the means of even the most dedicated foodie. All the food was perfectly seasoned, creatively plated and, hot (one of my gripes at so many fine dining establishments).  This is probably the first review I have written where it is impossible to choose a stand out dish. All were perfectly executed. It is obvious that the menu was design as a whole and not just 6 individual courses served one after another. Thank you Ben and the team for a memorable night.

review_data.review_title: Great good value food in a buzzing atmosphere
review_data.review: We arrived at this restaurant to find that they were fully booked except for one table, which we took eagerly!  They seemed to have found the right balance: great food throughout; efficient and freindly staff; good location; multi-cultural clientele; great value (we paid 299 dirhams for a 3-course meal for 2).  Go if you can, but try and book ahead.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Delicious meat thali and great service. Surroundings very nice, great decor. Would come again. Thanks!

review_data.review_title: Nice change from traditional European Food
review_data.review: After eating traditional European food for over a week we were searching for a change. After reviewing TA we decided on Taaj Palace. Its a very simple India decor with no AC. We had the Vindalo and Biryani with garlic naan and it was all delicious. We had a bottle of Czech vino which was bad compared to the India vino we sampled. All in all it was a very good India dinner and approx 29 Euro without tip.

We hadn't planned to eat here but after we had a problem at another restaurant nearby we found this on TripAdvisor and promptly walked there in our Louboutins - the walk was worth it - very authentic feel when you walk in - with the staff being very attentive. Good food and wine and was reasonably priced for good food. Would recommend for good Italian food!!

This place is really cool, you go down into a nice warm space that smells delicious, the service team are very friendly and quick to greet and seat you. The pizza is fresh and has lots of flavour and a nice wine list to wash it down. Would definitely come back

Chamisse is a staple in our London list. They always deliver great service and delicious food.  I took a friend - who knows Lebanese food well, and is involved in the restaurant industry - for dinner this week, and he was impressed with the quality and flavours.  We ordered a selection of the hot and cold mezze, and every dish was perfect.  Always happy to recommend Chamisse, and will no doubt be going back soon.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Our go to when we want great food and great service
review_data.review: We return often, and each time are welcomed warmly and treated to the best Lebanese food in London. We have visited with friends from the UK, Lebanon, Syria, South Africa, Oman, Dubai, Singapore, Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Bangladesh and Turkey, and they all rate the food and service as excellent.  This time was no different.  We ordered the Yakhneh Loubieh (Green bean in tomato sauce) vegetarian and the Yakhnet Bameh (okra in tomato sauce) vegetarian. Both can be prepared as vegan if you mention it. The food was piping hot and delicious.  The service, as ever, was warm and attentive.  We've already made our next reservation.

I booked a table for an early dinner, so that the restaurant would be quieter.  The staff, as always, gave me a warm welcome and offered me my choice of tables. I wanted a relaxed meal, while doing some reading, and the service was attentive and perfectly placed, so that I felt comfortable enough to take my time, but also so that I never waited for service.  I ordered the Taboulleh Twist, houmous Beiruty, Falafel and Yakhnet Batinjen Vegetarian, and enjoyed some Lebanese coffee with it. At the end, I had their refreshing Café Blanc with some baklava.  Every dish was amazing, and I would visit weekly if I could.

We consistently come back to Chamisse, and we're often bringing friends back with us.  The food is always delicious and the service attentive. We've come here with friends from the UK, Oman, Syria, South Africa, and they've all enjoyed the food and said how good it was.  Thank you to the staff for always being welcoming and for giving us somewhere to always share great food with good friends.

We visit Chamisse every couple of weeks and have never been let down.  We brought a friend here for dinner on Saturday evening, and again, the staff at Chamisse were incredibly welcoming. They were happy to make recommendations from the menu and were knowledgeable about all the dishes.  The food was delivered quickly, and every dish was tasty.  We've been visiting Chamisse for around two years now and have found it to be consistently excellent.  Were very happy to recommend.

We found this place by chance, loved it. The staff were really friendly and had a laugh with us. The place is stunning and the food was outstanding. Set menu/price, very good value. Before you get your starter you get 19 little Morrocan starters, beautifully done. Very relaxing. Would recommend. I had the sea bass which was beautiful.

We went here by chance and were lucky to get the last table, there were many after us asking but we're denied. Tip, if you like to eat later there are better chance to get a table without reservation. The owners see working one ont the kitchen and one waiting tables. It is a friendly atmosphere so we're well taken care of. I had a really hot pepper and a sole file all well prepared and cooked and Tasted good. All and all I think the ratings are maybe on the high side but it is quite good.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Excellent food, service, and cocktails. Try the bebek. Juicy meat and crunchy skin. The Ayan Timbungan is also a winner. Shout out to Ariyani for the great service and recommendations here in ubud.

We went there after a long walk in tbe chan elisa to arc de triumph. The metro was very easy and we were glad we came. We had two vegeterian dishes which were great. Quiet place , great host , lovely vibe. Plus - great price. Under 40 euro for two dishes a glass of wine and beer. We didnt have time for ther desert but we'll be back .

Found this place via 50 Best Discovery, and it is totally worth it. Classic setting, excellent service, and interesting and very well presented dishes. Did not try the wine pairing on offer and opted for a bottle of wine instead (good quality, affordable prices). Overall, it is hard to find a tasting menu fine dining experience for 37 USD anywhwere else in the world. Highly recommended if you are in the area. Great value for money !

Lamb shoulder and boulangere potatoes - take it or leave it. What a marvellous business model!  Meal costs $45 and the meat will easily serve 3 (could stretch to 4 but then you’ll be light on spuds). We had ours delivered to our motel room for an $8 supplement (credit card accepted with phone order), which not only saved me the effort of finding them but also meant the food was with us sooner than I could have got it myself! Full marks for service.  The lamb was incredibly tender although not as flavoursome as that offered by a certain Gourmet restaurant in Wanaka, but had we not eaten there I too would give this five stars [as a take-away].

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: I visited restaurant on lunch time and ordered Paneer kadai and it was excellent. Garlic naan was good. Salted lassi is also good.  i will recommended this restaurant in Prague for vegetarians.
We took buffet menu and it was great, Food was awesome and excellant taste. Dal was excellent, taste was good.

Visited this place on my recent trip to Prague. Located near old town and the restaurant is in the basement. Decent place and we ordered our dishes as well as butter chicken. It tasted nothing like butter chicken and we told the manager about it. I appreciate the fact that they listened to our complain and acknowledged the same. They also took of the charges off our final bill. Other then this everything else was good. Service also has a scope for improvement. Overall I would recommend this place for Indian food.

Overall, we really enjoyed our lunch here. Beautiful setting, good service, good food. The Tsarskaya oysters were excellent. Seafood salad ok but would not reorder. Tuna ceviche dish was very oily and lacking in zing. Grilled red snapper delicate and perfectly cooked. All washes down with cold crisp white wine. It was more expensive than any other meal we had in the island, but we didn't begrudge that for the overall experience.

review_data.review_title: Views are amazing, food was nothing special
review_data.review: We also ate here on our last night in Istanbul having had some great meals (and views) in our 5 night stay. The view here is stunning, overlooking pretty much all of Istanbul - panoramic views! We hadn't booked, but got a table on the terrace looking out over hagia Sophia museum. Waiters were efficient but took time to take our order as were having pictures taken with a group of Australian ladies! The food was good, we both had lamb and it was cooked really well , but nothing spectacular in terms of service or presentation of the food. We also tried a mojito - probably one of the worst I've tasted! I'd recommend for the views alone!

Hard to find after dark, as taxi barred from square. Eventually found it was behind the Café de France east side of main square, along the alley beside and 100m further on. Small, but with an upper deck, seating 10 tables. Sadly, this was accessed by a very tight spiral staircase, not very suitable for the elderly. Unfortunately, it was pretty full and the service slow. People weren't even served in order. No alcohol, but some nice fruit juices. Decent Moroccan salad starter. The chicken tagine was ok even if the vegetables were overcooked, but the cous cous (also in a tagine) had seriously overcooked, almost unrecognisable, soggy vegetables, and was nearly bereft of its supposed chicken. The one saving grace was that it was very cheap. Not rushing back.

Nicely laid out Lebanese restaurant, which looks as if it also serves the local Lebonese community. Seasonally decorated, and very pleasant owner and staff. Tried the parsley salad with lettuce and pomegranate seeds, which was delightful, coming with superlight, freshly made flatbreads. The mince skewer mains, and chargrilled fish were excellent, the potato and rice sides were great too, special praise due for the rice. Never saw the wine list, but got an inexpensive bottle of Lebanese white. Excellent service, great food, and super value. Thoroughly recommended.

Booked via the website and got a confirmation email. Decided to scout it out, and had difficulty finding, it being in a narrow street, and with no signage. Only opens in the evening, but was able to see a tangle of chairs and tables covered in sheets. Apprehensive. What a transformation on arrival!! Nicely laid out, with elegantly laid tables, plus a "La Palette" sign outside on the street. Dimly lit, with triangular bar at the rear. Candles on the tables. Charming staff served us drinks, wine and an excellent meal, in pleasant ambience. Only minor downsides were nearby smokers, and slightly over-loud music. Can recommend the "burnt" avocados, coming with prawns on sticks, and also the mains of lamb shank (cooked 7 hours), and the monkfish on the bone, coming with curry sauce and risotto. Fabulous. Thoroughly recommended.
This is a good value pitta stop and the homemade lemonade packs a lunch! The fries are a tasty addition. Quick turnaround and cafe style seating onto the square

Stylish high view restaurant with an artistic interior and lively atmosphere. The menu is interesting and food beautifully presented. Cocktail menu is diverse and innovative. The service is very efficient

review_data.review_title: Outstanding traditional Turkish cuisine and good value
review_data.review: We chose this restaurant from the TA reviews we were not disappointed. We didnt reserve and were lucky to get a table as the restaurant is small and was full shortly thereafter The food is excellent, particularly the mixed meze starters and the Anatolian chicken casserole which is served dramatically in a heated fire tableside. Very friendly owners. Would highly recommend.

review_data.review_title: Excellent and very tasty business lunch for 178 CZK
review_data.review: After a few months I have decided to repeat my visit to the Blue Wagon as I still remember their fabolous dishes. This time I went just for a quick three course business lunch menu for a very reasonable price of 178 CZK. Soup excellent, main course excellent, dessert excellent. Real value for money and highly recommended not only for dinner, but also for surprisingly delicious business lunch. I haven't had such good beef on mushrooms with sauce and dumplings for quite a long time, the meat was just melting down in mouth. And even though I am usually not raving about sweets, their dessert a brownie like cade made from rye flour was exactly as tailor made to my taste not so sweet. These guys know to do their job very well and I am sure to repeat the visit soon.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Hidden gem near downton. Wonderful experience
review_data.review: Very nice expression of Czech Modern Cuisine. Staff is very professional and also enthusiastic about what they do. Meals are perfect and the prices are very reasonable for the top level gastronomy. I strongly suggest to try their Veal Cheek or steak from Deer Nail together with Brunello di Montalcino 2007 DOCG Mastrojanni. We had this and it was absolutely outstanding. Highly recommended hidden gem.

The restaurant is a bit off the beaten track, but well worth the visit. We had the set Khmer menu. We had our first taste of fried crickets (appetizer) and the wontons were excellent. All in all a lovely meal in nice surroundings and on top of it for a good cause.

review_data.review_title: Fantastic steak on our last night in Argentina!
review_data.review: Spotted this restaurant walking past at lunchtime and decided to return for dinner. I wanted an Argentinian steak! (For our last night in Argentina and also the last night of our 9 week round the world, once in a lifetime vacation! I was not disappointed, Jonatan recommended a lovely Cabernet Franc wine and looked after us supremely well. The sophisticated ambiance of this place is classic and relaxed. Ideal to dine in couples or groups. Don’t walk by this place or you’ll miss a great restaurant!

We came here during our stay in Marrakech, and it was great although a little difficult to find at first. It's really good when you fancy something that is less traditionally Moroccan and we chose to go for two pizzas, a chicken one (45dh) and a vegetarian one (50dh), both of which were really good however by the end you started to notice the dough was quite sweet which made it difficult to finish it all. The price was really good and they had a great selection of juices and soft drinks which were also really nice. You also got bread and dip before your meal included in the price with no additional cover charge. The service was really good and prompt too and the lady who served us spoke good English and was very polite. The restaraunt was clean and we would recommend going here for sure.

review_data.review_title: lovely place to enjoy a meal
review_data.review: I enjoyed my first fish amok at Tevy's place and I would certainly go back. The restaurant offers good quality traditional Khmer dishes.  I like the fact that Tevy's place empowers women in the workplace, and they are single use plastic free.  Value for money is fantastic.

The Kitchen table is a great place for late afternoon and evening drinks. The Pizzas are amazing, a really good size and so delicious . There's a wide range of toppings, including some that you wouldn't necessarily think of. You can eat in or take away and also there's room service . We did eat out at the Blue Mango a couple of times and the experiences here were really good too. We decided to try to lamb steak at the kitchen table and were so glad we did, we enjoyed it so much we had our last holiday meal at the Kitchen Table, this time we had the pork dish, and this did not disappoint either . The kitchen table is definitely on a par with the blue mango. Poppy and the whole team are so friendly , helpful , always smiling , they are a great bunch, and an absolute credit to their employers. Thanks to all for a great stay!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We ate at the blue mango a few evenings during our stay. The duck dish and the fried rice dishes were really good. They have a specials board . We did have risotto one night and I tried the beetroot one which I wouldnt have normally thought of.trying. Decent wine list, good service and friendly staff. Thank you

Went to this restaurant by recomendation from TripAdvisor.. It resulted in wisiting this restaurant several times in 2019. Went back here in 2020. Same lovley food and same friendly Staff who took the time to chat a little bit. Surly we will be back again to eat Chicken Tikka Masala with garlic nan

Grand Cru is a terrific restaurant....it would be top notch anywhere! Beautiful setting; romantic; great service; great wine list, and terrific food! What else is there? Loved the salmon egg amuse bouche; the quail appetizer with kale and quince was great; and OMG, the white truffled pasta was out of this world! This place is as good as it gets! Our best upscale meal in Prague! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

Excellent food, prompt and attentive service in a great environment.  We had the Surf n Turf with onion rings, fries, asparagus and creamed spinach.  The lobster would have benefited from a garlic butter but otherwise couldn’t fault the food or the service.  We will definitely be returning when next in NYC.
Lovely welcome. Very friendly staff. Good choice of food and beverages. Worth a visit before long flight home Would use in future when visiting our daughter and son in law.

We just finished a sumptuous dinner at this venue, and I felt like I had to share how outstanding the food and quality of service was.  We started the evening with their Brie Melters, which are pieces of Brie cheese deep-fried in a homemade batter. We paired the appetizer with a glass of Prosecco, currently on promotion.  Following this, we ordered the Lamb Stew and the Spaghetti Deluxe, in a rich red wine sauce. Sensational!  All-in-all, the quality of the ingredients, combined with the skilled knowledge of the kitchen brigade and the professionalism of the staff made this evening way more special than it should have been.  Highly recommended if you are in Kathu, or in Phuket Town.

We visited Thong Dee this Sunday as the missus was craving for their Sunday Roast. The servings were exceptional, offering several options such as beef, lamb, chicken, etc.  I myself enjoyed a Brie Melter for the appetizer, followed by their gourmet Pad Kaprao, which was perfect!  The staff and the owners were all very welcoming and easy to talk to. This is a must-visit restaurant if you are in or around Kathu.

review_data.review_title: Tasty as and fresh ingredients....good value for Queenstown!
review_data.review: We ordered takeout stockman and bushman tacos (beef/pork) from this hole in the wall and were happy with the tasty flavours and fresh ingredients....good value in overpriced Queenstown!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover

review_data.review_title: Delicious Thai fare and reasonable by Queenstown standards!
review_data.review: We ordered the Hor-Mok Seafood (Blue Cod, Prawn & Squid) as takeaway on the recommendation of The Lonely Planet and so pleased we did.....it was a generous serve with delicious seafood and particularly tender squid and reasonable by Queenstown overpriced standards! The dish went perfectly with our Chard Farm gewurtztraminer that we had bought cellar door.....a must do visit too! Back to the restaurant.....the service was pleasant and friendly.....would definitely return and have the same dish :)
As we were staying in the Aira Boutique hotel, we had quite a few dinners here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was great. The food was excellent!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: You should not come to Siem Reap and miss out on eating here. Gourmet local food at local prices. This place would thrive in NYC. Try the mackerel. Very clean, great menu, great staff, easy to find. If you’re staying at a four or five star hotel you’ll feel right at home eating here.
The burgers are for sure the best in town and the fries are out of this world. The best i have ever got. Just remember you have to pay in cash (they have atm at the entrance)

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We visited Manzil La Tortue for their pool day and lunch, which is excellent value. For 290DH we got two delicious courses each, and use of the pool all day - this also included towels and a late afternoon snack.  The food was absolutely delicious - some of the best we had in Marrakech - and the service went above and beyond. We were there celebrating my birthday and my partner was able to arrange a bottle of champagne with the owner, which they didn't have on their wine list. Nothing was too much trouble and we had a fantastic day.  One thing to note, the pool isn't heated, but that actually makes for a welcome respite from the hot sunshine. It really is a tranquil environment and a fabulous place to have a relaxing day. If we had known about Manzil La Tortue when we were booking our accommodation, we would have definitely booked to stay there. Highly recommended.  Top tip: If you wish to do their pool and lunch day and you're staying in central Marrakech, call up and book their transfer service (costs 150DH each way) to avoid the inevitable haggling with the taxi driver once you arrive!
The best place to have breakfast in Alfama - they may look super simple, but the scrambled eggs were the best scrambled eggs I've ever eaten. Fab place.

review_data.review_title: Local cuisine in a nice setting and convenient location
review_data.review: We took our dinner at Chanrey Tree at tye recommendation of the hotel we are staying out. It was located close to where we were based. The service is kind and welcoming - perhaps a little over attentive with it all happening quite fast. The food covered a broad selection of local cuisine which was nice but not outstanding. Seats in the front garden area offer a lovely experience surrounded by the gardens with the buzz of the street not far to watch the world go by.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: We had a lovely dinner to celebrate a birthday on our first night in Bangkok. The restaurant is run by two sisters and has all female staff. The food is an adventure into local cuisine with flair! We enjoyed a degustation and paired with premium wines. The experience - food, wine and service was flawless. It’s been hard to find anything better. A real delight and a treasure on Siem Reap.
Bills Bar and Burger s a popular spot for fast tasty food. Nice bar And good service. The wings are spicy and the menu vast.
Spice Symphony is a very enjoyable Indian restaurant. Nice ambiance and decor, good friendly service and very tasty food. Good vegetarian & vegan options. Recommended.
Spice Symphony is a very enjoyable Indian restaurant. Nice ambiance and decor, good friendly service and very tasty food. Good vegetarian & vegan options. Recommended.

We are at white orchid on two occasions over our ten night stay. The food was delicious and was a mix of Thai / Chinese cuisine. The Thai green curry in particular was very good and the best we’ve had outside of Thailand.  Our only comment was that this restaurant was not part of the all inclusive package so you only got a contribution towards the cost of the meal. We couldn’t see a reason why this wasn’t included in the package (particularly the drinks, which were expensive, notwithstanding they were the same drinks included for free in the restaurants/bars just next door).  Overall a fantastic experience and well worth a visit, but just be wary of the additional charges.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Exceptional food and great value in the hotel all inclusive package
review_data.review: We loved the food and menu options here so much that we ended up eating here 4 nights out of the 10 that we stayed at the hotel, and didn’t have one bad dish. We would particularly recommend the aubergine starter and the beef main course which were delicious. The portions were generous - not like most upmarket pasta restaurants. The service was also brilliant - the waiters were attentive, asked when you were ready for the next course, and the food was quick to arrive. In particular we were served by Sanjay on a couple of nights who was excellent.

Second attempt to eat here…seated at the bar. It’s a steakhouse so I got to order that. Rib eye steak medium, side orders are: fries and a salad. Steak was cooked medium as requested but shame they still put some sorta sauce and onions on it after I ordered it plain. (Sauce hides steak flavor) Salad was quite good. Loses a star for sauce on steak.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: I saw this place on tripadvisor and we decided to give it a try! Very small restaurant with friendly staff Great prices - see menu on my photos Wish we had found it sooner!

We hosted drinks for several friends few days ago and everybody really enjoyed their time. the cocktails were really good as well as the bar food. Staff is very friendly and the service was quick. We have been here a few times and always felt it was relatively under-appreciated. Probably because prices are slightly on the higher side. However they serve food from Jamie's next door which makes it even more amazing.

We decided to try this restaurant for the good reviews on TripAdvisor. When we were there for lunch, some of them came in tour groups and occupied rows of tables, so clearly seats will fill up easily. Make a reservation to avoid disappointment.  The food was so-so - we ordered from the set menu so we had a choice between the Western set and the Asian set. For the price we paid, the food was not bad. It was interesting to watch the trainee staff learning on the job.  If you wish to tip them, do so at a box at the entrance of the restaurant - when we visited, they were raising money to go on a class trip together during their vacation.

review_data.review_title: Almost as good as pizza from Napoli
review_data.review: Had the margherita pizza and it reminded me of the pizza I had in Naples. Fresh tomato, basil and tasty mozzarella. Crust was a little chewy, but flavorful. Pizza s are "12 and on the expensive side. Consider a margherita pizza in southern Italy is around $4, the pizza at motorino is $15. Overall, true italian pizza, but on the expensive side.

review_data.review_title: Very good, not the best in NYC
review_data.review: Overall, very good Neapolitan pizza. Slightly expensive. Crust was on the bland side and did not have that certain flavor when 00 flour is utilized. Slightly disappointed with seating. Went early and did not have a reservation. Plenty of tables available and was given worst outside table available.

Best pizza in NYC! Crust is light and tasty; fior di latte mozzarella, sweet and creamy; sauce just sweet enough; cooked to perfection. Restaurant is small and tight, but definitely worth the visit if you want outstanding Neapolitan pizza. No need for toppings, just get the margherita with the fior di latte mozzarella.

Lovely, quirky and small restaurant. They serve a tasting menu with very reasonably priced wines to accompany it, or you can go a la carte and either choose a bottle or, again, ask them to recommend wines by the glass. In the wine list they will do 3, 5 or 7 glasses for a set price, so you know what you will be paying. The whole meal was very good value. I wasn't keen on one of the wines and Salvatore changed it immediately, without any hesitation.  The food was very good, but, as others have commented, the wine is really the star. A pleasant experience, although it is very intimate so difficult not to overhear others' conversations whilst you are dining.  The hosts are charming, a really friendly couple and both speak excellent English.
