A word of warning about finding it: the street it is located on is very long, we nearly made the mistake of walking from our hotel in Palermo Soho, and it doesn't feel like a very safe neighbourhood. Our taxi driver mistook the address so had to drop us two blocks further down the road as it's a one-way street, and we didn't feel very comfortable walking, especially as we managed to miss it altogether at first. Make sure your taxi driver gets the house number right.

Great food and wine. Really great. Sommelier Diego was fantastic at explaining and remembering everyone's name! Luis was on had to discuss the food, wine and anything else. Got to meet great people from all over the world. Highly recommend!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Fabulous locations and food (lots of vegan options)
review_data.review: We ordered most of the Vegan options on the menu and shared them between 3 adults. Probably over ordered! However it was great to taste many dishes and they were all delicious. Friendly service and delicious food, really great to have so many vegetarian and vegan options.

It is probably the best Indian restaurants around. For the price paid, you get double the value on taste. The food is absolutely delicious and gives you a heavenly experience. The service is fantastic and ambiance is good. On weekends it can get busy so be there early for a first come first serve allocation. Their specialties are the Kebabs and the Biriyani's. I wholeheartedly give my five star rating to this restaurant chain.
Service was very slow even though there were only about 8 customers and 2 staff. Cocktails (Manhattan and Margarita) were low quality.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: I went to Source Cafe for lunch with a colleague the other day. The food we had was delicious. I would recommend the chicken schnitzel and the lime coconut cake! The only downside of the experience was the difficulty we had getting the staff to come to our table to order more food and correct the bill.

review_data.review_title: Amazing food in a serene setting
review_data.review: WILD was one of the first restaurants I visited when I moved to Siem Reap. After the first I visited I was hooked. The spring rolls at WILD are delicious! Along with the traditional fillings they also offer a wide variety of savoury and sweet ones not to mention that their cocktails are amazing! The restaurant itself is a gorgeous place to spend time. The owners have kept the number of tables low for the amount of space they have and the result is well worth it. Be aware if you want to visit on the weekends however, this place is extremely popular and is usually fully booked! I would recommend WILD to anyone looking for a relaxed atmosphere and delicious food.
The Marriott Cafe offers a variety of cuisines and consequently there is something for everyone. The food is good and tasty. Recommended

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Sea Fire Salt is primarily a sea food restaurant. The food is cooked n different salts which is unique.

We dined here for an early dinner and the lovely staff seated us out of the way (we had two kids with us!) and provided crayons for the kids. The wine I chose wasn't to my liking so the staff kindly swapped it over for me, no dramas at all. Such a great asset to the restaurant to have such understanding, helpful staff. They don't have a kids menu and sides are extra so it can get quite expensive. Food is excellent, full of flavour and really delicious. One of our sides was some chips and found the serving quite small however everything was very tasty and the service was great so I would recommend.

Ate here on our first night in Siem Reap after reading the reviews. A new restaurant and a lovely ambience from the moment you are greeted at the front with a cold towel and peach tea, being walked by drummers to the restaurant, to the food itself. The dancing was interesting but the food was great. Choice of set menu $16-24 pp or an a la carte. Would recommend. We asked our concierge to book but there were some tables left when we arrived.

We went here on the recommendation of Hila our Tango teacher and we were. Ot disappointed. The beef de lomo was the best I have tasted. Be prepared for a large steak! Alfonso the waiter was very helpful. Surprisingly we also shared a chocolate fondant pudding with ice cream.... So indulgent. The prices were very reasonable. Highly recommended.

Do great to find an Indian restaurant with loads of non-meat options. Here, they are not sundries but main meals - just like in mostly vegetarian India! I'm not vegetarian but prefer no meat in my Indian food. In addition, 4 if is walking of the street on a Saturday night gut s warm welcome and attentive and informative service throughout. Wonderful.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Fine food in a relaxed ambient
review_data.review: We had dinner at Les Apotres and had the best experience. Food is prepared in small servings to share, so you get to try from several dishes. Service is done by its owners in a friendly and profesional fashion. Prices are moderated given the quality.

A fabulous lunch experience. We enjoyed the 6 course lunch tasting menu which is highly recommended. We chose not to do the wine pairing though and didn’t have the optional cheese course, but there was more than enough food.Service was very good from the welcome at the front door to when we left. Service is included and if you’re choosing not to have the wine paring, there’s a great wine list. We will definitely be going back.

review_data.review_title: The best place to eat in Istanbul
review_data.review: We had dinner at August 2015, i could say this was one of the best dinners I've had in my hole life! I had "Mandi" it was delicious, my mom had meat filet with smashed potato, which was really delicious as she said, the incredients had very good quality, (meat, olive oil, butter, fresh vegetables) this was far away from a turistic place even though it was in the centre of the old town. The view was MAGNIFICENT, we could view Haya Sofia and Blue Mosque as we dined, so romantic and have the feeling and smell of Istanbul. I would strongly recomment, and i will definetly visit again!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: I had a wonderful afternoon tea at the Grosvenor with three members of my family to celebrate a birthday. We all loved it, we were seated by the window and we loved the relaxed feel in the room. The food was perfect and our waiter Saiful was so friendly, attentive yet professional. I hope to return soon.

Excellent service and a cool underground vibe, cocktails are pricey but probably the best in Marrakech.  Food was good but I actually expected better given the rave reviews. Had the carpaccio and the saffron seafood risotto, both nice but nothing close to Michelen level as some reviews suggest.  Expect to pay around 900dh for 2 x 2 courses plus a bottle of wine

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Great food and service. The owner really takes care of his guests. I would add the provenance of the wine in the wine menu together with the year of production.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;History Buff;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: This was my first time ever having these dumplings. My friend took me there for lunch it was very busy. We ordered the dumplings as a appetizer. When the waiter brought them out he give instructions on how to eat them they are filled with pork vegetables.and broth. You pick them up with your soup spoon and bite a hole in them and suck out this delicious soup and then eat the pork.dumpling. So heavenly. Wished I would've order them for a entree. The servers were very impatient when taking our order but all the food was good.

review_data.review_title: Eating (too much and too well) for a good cause
review_data.review: Wow. We were staying just down the block and after reading the reviews decided to take Haven in for an early dinner. The staff is wonderful. The food is over the top good. “That’s the best chicken satay I’ve ever had.” “The schnitzel is awesome,” and we’ve lived in Germany. “The curry is frickin great, why cant they have a ‘all you can eat menu?’” OK. That wasn’t actually said but I did think it. The deserts were awesome as well. And what the owners/directors are doing for young Cambodians is worthy of your patronage and a healthy tip.

review_data.review_title: Better places to eat in Queenstown
review_data.review: We booked this restaurant due to reviews on Tripadvisor and were unfortunately disappointed with our meal. It is a very busy Italian restaurant and bookings are essential but I think it is trading now on past excellence. The restaurant is on the small side and we were crammed into a small table for 2 right at the back of the restaurant. Given menus and told specials and then took a while to come back for our drink order. We gave our food order at the same time. Our shared entree arrived fairly quickly and before we had finished it, our mains arrived. I commented that we had not completed our entree - no reaction and main meals pushed onto the table. Our entree was dough balls which were ok - really bread rolls with olive oil. For mains we had spaghetti carbonara and zucchini fusilli. The pasta is said to be home made and it was nice but the sauces served with both meals was lacking and the meals were not very hot. It felt like we were expected to eat up and get out as soon as possible so they could fill the seats again. Better places to eat in Queenstown.

If you want to have a cozy dinner with someone this is the place to go. The space is amazing, specially the top flor and the staff is very kind. The food is awesome and very well cooked. Entrees are delicious as well. The only negative side of it is the location that made it very hard to find a place to park the car.
Inside Le Bristol, Le 114 Faubourg is an elegant restaurant with a very good menu and an excellent wine list. Service is second to none.

review_data.review_title: Good food, service a bit slow.
review_data.review: We visited this restaurant during a recent city break because it was situated a few metres from our hotel. We were seated promptly and our order taken quickly. We opted for fish soup for starters. This was delicious, worth the visit alone. For main course we settled for grilled sea bass. The fillets were displayed conveniently in a cabinet in front of our table. The kitchen area was beside this and we were able to see our fish being cooked. The fillets were placed on the counter and calls for the waiting staff were made, but it took about 5 minutes from then for the plates to be delivered. The fish was nice in spite of this. In hindsight we probably should have served ourselves. Our desert was pistachio ice cream which was delicious. With wine and beer the bill came to a reasonable £47.00. Overall service was a bit slow after a good start.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: It was our first day at Prague, we had been to Lal Quila for Lunch, They have Buffet on Weekdays which is quite reasonably Priced at 120 KC. The food was tasty, we had also ordered Mango Lassi, which was quite refreshing.W Would very much recommend this Restaurant to India. Cuisine Lovers.
Delicious Banh Mi, including a vegetarian option. Very reasonably priced, and nice to sit on the mezzanine floor watching the world go by below.
It was like eating in an oasis! Tables are dotted around this beautiful, winding garden creating very secluded and atmospheric spaces. Food and service was good and the prices were reasonable.

Wow. What an impressive restaurant. Beautiful wine, excellent service and stunning food. You definitely need to book in advance if you want to visit as it is very small and fills up quickly. Highly recommended.

review_data.review_title: Best dinner in Siem Reap- Cambodian gastronomy
review_data.review: Best dinner in Siem Reap! Love the story behind this wonderful restaurant and it’s all-female super team. Slight tucked away, the restaurant is spread over two floors and several rooms, so the place retains an intimate atmosphere. Service was superb from start to finish- everyone was charming and knowledgeable and welcoming. The set menu ($45) was absolutely sensational- ever successive course was even better than the previous. Each course is small and perfectly proportioned so you finish the meal feeling full but uncomfortable. True Cambodian street food morphed into high end gastronomy. Fantastic night - perfect for a romantic date, but also a fun place for a group too. Highly recommended.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: This restaurant must have one of the best views in the world and good food to match
review_data.review: I can't tell you how impressed we were by this restaurant. The views over the Bosphorus and the Golden Horne were breathtaking. The staff were helpful and the food good and not expensive. The menu is typically Turkish. Highly recommended.

Omg…the tacos are so addicting and flavorful. The pictures do not do them justice. We had steak tacos and wanted more immediately. Came back the next day for chicken and steak both. They do get a line outside but it moves fast. Counters inside that you stand at to eat. Our only dilemma is now we are obsessed and have no way to get them since we were just visiting. We will never pass up a visit here if we ever find ourselves in NY again. Thank you!!!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Our best meal in Siem Reap
review_data.review: This was a lovely restaurant. We sat outside in the garden area which was lovely and really relaxing. We had great cocktails and the food was delicious. Stayed a while after eating with a couple more cocktails and did not feel hassled to leave. The price was very reasonable, not the cheapest place to eat in SR but, considering the quality of the food and the atmosphere, definitely good value and we both agreed Urban Tree was our favourite restaurant during our stay in Siem Reap.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Beach Goer

review_data.review: When we arrived we were a little sceptical. It really is a very small and local restaurant. There were no tables inside so we were given a table outside but it was very hot as the cooking was done there too. I think the waiters could see we were melting so when a table became free inside they asked us if we would like to move which was so thoughtful. We did and it was bless to be in the air-con. The menu is small and local but the food we had was really tasty and so cheap we could not believe it. We also had a couple of beers which were the cheapest we had anywhere. You cannot help be impressed with Tevy's story, (which you can read on posters in the restaurant), her survival and the loss of her family members is heartbreaking and now she helps young women have a better life by giving them work and training in her restaurant.  I would recommend this small and friendly little place for lovely and tasty local food and the price is a great bonus.

review_data.review_title: Good good and service, every time
review_data.review: Rangoli delivers good quality and service every time. This is my tenth visit for both buffet and a la cart with friends and solo.  The all-you-can-eat buffet from Mondays to Fridays offers guests a range of over half a dozen curries to opt for. Cooking is skilled, tasty and excellent value.  In all my visits I've never had any negative experience.

review_data.review_title: Come here for memorable service and food.
review_data.review: Rangoli doesn't mess around when authentic Indian food is concerned. From start to finish, everything on the menu is well prepared and presented.  I opted for the chicken Vindaloo - a hot dish for those into spice. I particularly liked the finishing touches of Mukhwas, which serves as authentic after dinner mints. /Mukh/ and /vas/ - denoted in the name, Mukhwas - literally translate as mouth and smell.  A meal consisting of a meat curry, rice, garlic naan (breads), five drinks and a Kulfi (Indian ice-cream) came to a very reasonable 840 CZK (just under 30GBP). This was plenty for the two of us and shall be returning with friends over the next couple of weeks.  As for the service I cannot fault it and was the prominent quality of our dining experience. The waiters greeted me with clemency and their attention to our overall comfort throughout our dining experience was sharp.

review_data.review_title: Delicious tasting menu – rest is average
review_data.review: We came here because of the good reviews. We ordered the tasting menu but exchanged the mains and the deserts. Which was a mistake. The first courses of the tasting menu were fantastic, delicious and nicely presented. We loved the scallops and the carpaccio was absolutely delicious. Very disappointing were the mains. We exchanged the lamb to seabass and beef lok lak. Both were not really good and not nicely presented. We had the feeling we got food from a different restaurant. The desserts were o.k, but just too big. They had a great service and great drinks. Overall the tasting menu was really nice and absolutely recommendable. But you should stick to this if you are a real foodie.

review_data.review_title: The full flavour of the Mediterranean
review_data.review: A cozy, family restaurant just a few steps from Camden High Street that makes you feel you instantly landed on a sunny island in Greece. As you get in, you will be welcomed by the owner and his team who will nicely make sure that everything is ok along your meal: their service is kind, attentive and discreet: it is clear they want to make sure that you fully enjoy the experience. The food is just lovely. We had the combined platter for two: the starters (tzatziki, hummus and taramosalata) were served with warm soft bread (and we asked for more!); the meat was tender, tasty and perfectly cooked; the Greek salad was fresh and nicely seasoned. We left feeling a sense of having had a healthy dinner, great value for money and, as Italians, we recognized the full flavour of the Mediterranean! We will be back soon!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: I chose this restaurant because of the high ranking in TA (n°4 in Paris). The neighborhood is not all that good but I can't say I felt unsafe at any time on our way there and back by metro. The hospitality is very good: we got a warm welcome and all through the meal it stayed that way. After ordering some cocktails we had to wait for more than 1 hour before we got our menus! (after having asked for it). We then got some bread to cover the gap. The entry was presented beautifully on a plate but the mackerel was just smoked mackerel, nothing special. We ordered a beef medaillon for mains: the taste of mine was good and juicy but my wife's was actually bleu whereas it should have been medium rare. Also the temperature in the restaurant kept rising up till the point it was too hot to stil order dessert. We fled the restaurant. So a lower score to get the overall score back to a realistic level.

It is true that you get what you pay for. While this restaurant has prices that might be slightly higher than some other Italian restaurants here, the food is fabulous and it was one of the best meals I have had so far on this trip (I've been in Budapest, Vienna and now Prague). I ordered the meat ravioli in tomato sauce. It was very good, obviously homemade, and presented perfectly. Then, there was the pistachio semifreddo which was so yummy it makes you want to lick the plate! Our waiter (George) was attentive, friendly and so pleasant to chat with. We ate inside as the evening was a bit cool and seeing the light play off the Bohemian crystal chandeliers in the dining room was lovely. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a non-touristy place to eat which has a great menu selection. We are definitely going to go back before we leave Prague.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Had New Years eve dinner at this restaurant. It was a set tasting menu for the evening, absolutely delicious, everything we had was amazing. Hats off to the chef, it was truly great. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to every Prague traveler.

We ate here with a group - preordered menu. Each dish was excellent, from soup to desert. And the view from the dining room was fabulous, as you can see from the pictures. Don't hesitate to stop in here if you have the opportunity.

In early 2020 we had few lunches and dinners at this Essence Restaurant when they were situated at P. Hang Kanh. At that time the menu had many more dishes to choose from. The food was great. That is the reason we come back this restaurant ( at a new location) for our lunch. However sadly to said the dishes was not as good as before. Dishes was abit too oily. Was there any change of chefs? That..... management should know better. The service staffs was great, friendly and helpful with their suggestions. Many thanks to Miss Nat and May who served us well.

The mashed potatoes which came along with Chicken breast was exceptional. We licked the plate clean for the Chimichuri sauce that came with the Steak. Skinned Salmon was also prepared delicately and we loved it.  It's a MUST visit place. We will definitely come back for more.

review_data.review: Wow wow wow…….totally amazing!!! Don’t be put off by the alleyway leading to this front door, the restaurant is truly wonderful, staff very friendly and attentive, food delicious and setting is magical! Would highly recommend and hope to come back one day!!

Had the pleasure of breakfast here and it was amazing. The service at the W is exceptional and the breakfast crew certainly keep the standard maintained. AK was a delight as he made suggestions from the a la carte breakfast menu which complemented the buffet. Along with the vitamin shot/nutrient juice, the “decent coffee” which is hard to find in Bali, and the range of pastries to complement the protein, FIRE needs to be experienced at least once if you go to the W.
found this place last year when we visited Queenstown and made sure to return here again this year. Fresh, delicious tacos that will satisfy your cravings.... Must try!
This restaurant provide the best panoramic view to istanbul from the top of intercontinental hotel. They served also the best delicious deserts i have ever taste in Turkey.

The St. Regis Restaurant was a treat. Great presentation and selection of foods that would satisfy most palates for breakfast. We ate there four mornings and the staff was excellent. Lunch on the day we arrived was also very satisfying. We ate dinner at the St Regis one evening and found it to have a lot of interesting food that tended toward Michelin. Unique reconstructed food. Not had norm. Worth a try. The view of the city shows the energy of Buenos Aires.

Great atmosphere, great food, Great host and service. We truly enjoyed the experience and the warm welcome. We eat here a few times per month and never disappointed. Food and drinks are beautiful. Thank you so much!

review_data.review: Had a great dinner (again!) at Thong Dee, we enjoyed the Sunday roast, always busy and great atmosphere. They have many specials on different days of the week, easy to follow on Facebook. The food is always spot on, service impeccable. We have a small baby which is challenging sometimes in a restaurant but at Thong Dee we are so well looked after and we can really enjoy our dinner without worrying too much about our son. Any request or special requirements they are ready to support. We’ll certainly return soon!! Thanks Thong Dee team see you again!

I eat here about once a week, always something nice on the menu, Food is fantastic everything I tried, good portions not too large, friendly service, very kind prices, I can't wait to go back there again

review_data.review_title: The best Neapolitan Pizza in Brooklyn
review_data.review: These guys have done their homework, imported the oven and flour and have dedicated themselves to the art of Neapolitan pizza-making. Simple and perfect! Crispy, chewy crust, slightly wet center, fresh tomato sauce and cheese. You can't go wrong at Sottacasa. The wine list is short but affordable with a number of drinkable options. The backyard space is terrific on a warm night and the whole place seems to glow with warmth on cold evenings. Highly recommended after ten plus visits..

review_data.review: We come from Europe and were invited here for drinks - took a Cab which had a bit of difficulty finding the place. It's in an inner courtyard to a hotel, but not too hard to find. We sat outside in the warm evening ambiance, great settings, chairs, pillows, lighting, etc. Very attentive personal and service (despite covid) and great menus with loads of little nicely warm items, sharing plates, Tapas, cheese boards, etc things to be had. I really have to promote that menu, it's unbelievable!! Prices are fair, service quick and attentive and THANK YOU for not having too loud music in our faces to destroy the very nice evening. We WILL be back!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Had finner here a rainy night - arrived at 2030pm and the small, cramped place was FULL. Had to wait 15min, but worth the while. Foods are delicious, drinks are non-alco as in everywhere in Marrakech, but delicious, set menus are a bargain at DIR 95 for set course. Great value, tasty, fresh and filling. Service is at tentative and competent, but - of course, very busy. You are seated somewhat cramped on small chairs, but you will forgive once your meal is derved. Highly recommended (and popular!)

We had dinner there recently and could not have been more pleased. The food was delicious and the staff couldn’t have been more friendly. We had a wonderful conversation with Sophy, while enjoying a fantastic meal. Chanrly Tree comes highly recommended.
If you are looking for authentic Indian food then this is the right place. Perfect spicy and good flavors like any up-class restaunt in India. Recommend veg dishes are Dal Makhani and Chana Masala.

The noodles station was just ok. It was not as tasty as the one in Lotte Saigon. The egg station was good and what we enjoyed most, is the Korean section. It has a make your own bibimbap. This is very different from Lotte Saigon breakfast spread. One thing missing was the juicing counter in Grill 63. In Lotte Saigon, they juice vegetables and fruits upon your request but I don't see it here, though. Eventhough fruits are available and juices were all displayed on the counter. The view from this restaurant is fantastic. Nothing beats a 63 floor view!

Found this gem based on TA reviews and could not be more pleased. It is located outside of the center but easily accessible by the B metro or several Trams. It is a quaint and cute local place with amazing people running it. The food was so delicious, it was one of our best meals. My gf had the veal cheek and I had the rabbit and both were prepared to perfection. The flavors were truly delicious. The two men who run the place were so nice, they attended to our every need and went above an beyond when a plate dropped and splattered on my gf's jacket. They treated us like friends and took care of everything we needed. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. The food, atmosphere and staff are top notch.

The restaurant is small, so be prepared to share a table with others at lunch time when it's busy. We will be back to try other entrees, next time in area. Thank you.

The school can accommodate 8 students, but our family (3 people) were the only ones there that morning. From going to the market to learn about and purchase food, to the cooking class itself, it was amazing. They cooked three different dishes and had a wonderful time! Thank you!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: I will start with the setting, which was lovely. Outside dining with blue and white tones, over looking the ocean (if you are there before sunset). Their online reservation system is VERY broken. We had a reservation for New Year’s Eve (we received an email confirmation) but when we showed up, they had no record of it. They informed us that they were not doing the menu that night and sent us on our way - where are you supposed to find another restaurant at 9 pm on New Year’s Eve? We decided to try again on January 2nd. Again made reservations online...and received an email confirmation. Got to the restaurant and they had no record of the reservation...at least this time they accommodated us. As I said before, a lovely setting. Our waiter had some struggles providing us with accurate menu information (actually was inaccurate on his description of several menu items) and overall the service was fair at best. If you are looking at their menu online - DON’T! It is not the same....and the menu at the restaurant was not descriptive - hard to know what you were going to get. We saw nothing served on a salt block. I am wondering if they have changed management or the menu compared to previous reviews - usually Trip Advisor is a good reflection of a restaurant- but not this time - look only at recent pictures and reviews! Most items were very overpriced! We had Tiger Prawn Cocktail - it was only 2 (two!) prawns and cost 750 Bhat! They were good, but really? We ordered two bottles of wine that were listed in the menu for 1700 bhat and we were charged 2000 bhat per bottle! As for main dishes- the ribeye was fair at best, the scallops were 4 scallops - very tender but otherwise very average...the best dish we had was the blue swimmer crab - 4 crabs, very tasty but a lot of work to eat. The Parmesan mashed potatoes were good, enough for two people. The Lobster Mac and Cheese? Not an accurate description at all...it was more of a pasta in a lobster bisque - no cheese to speak of. We ordered asparagus - sorry, they were out. So, I don’t usually tell people to avoid a restaurant - but we had much better meals and experiences in Phuket- eat elsewhere!
Beautiful place! With a beautiful view and great drinks!! The service is great and the staff is very friendly... always ask for Ercan!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: One of the best values I have ever had in NYC. Delicious pate and salads for starters, Two of my friends had the lamb dish. It was cooked perfectly and was really flavorful. Nice vegetables on the side. Not a big portion of lamb, but just right when you are having another course or two. I would go back once a week for the linguini with shrimp and crab. Don't let the squid ink scare you off. My friend had the steak frites which was ridiculously tender and tasty.  Excellent waiter who gave us good advice on wine and even gave us an extra scoop of pistachio gelato to share. Reasonable prices. This was my favorite meal of the trip.

review_data.review: I found the restaurant in trip advisor and give it a try. 100% thumbs up. The service was very attentive and friendly. We take steak which was very delicious. The beverage especially the Wine selection is ok, we select the Pinot Noir which was slightly to warm for my taste. Overall we are satisfied and recommend the restaurant. Also finally the bill was compared to other restaurants in this service and quality level on the lower end. In total we spend for 4 person around 115 $.

We stopped by a few times, and the line was out of the door. We finally came back one time and there was no line. We wanted to try the tacos, so we all ordered a different taco. They were really good tacos, and I am glad we decided to wait until there was no line, as we were unsure exactly how this restaurant works. It was nice that it wasn't busy for our first time here. Would definitely come back again if in NYC.
Fantastic service, tasty crepes, we went there even though it was far from our hotel and the place where we were and it really was an excellent choice! Highly recommend!
very nice poke place in Hanoi. established menu or create your own. a good number of options to make it.highly recommended!!!

review_data.review: Great experience with Cambodian Culture Dance we really enjoy.  1. Good food and reasonable price. 2. Location quiet and a lot of big tree around. 3. Culture dance look amazing.  We really recommend this restaurant to you.

Amazing food! Wonderfully friendly and beautiful terrace rooftop. If you are wondering if this place is good - yes! It’s exactly what you hope it is.  Tons of crap tourist food in the square, this is not like that. The Tagine is easily a 9/10. Very very good.

My husband heard about this place from a co-worker that insisted we try this place. Wow, what a great experience!!! Best taco’s my family and I have ever had. I tried a chicken & beef taco. We’ve traveled to Mexico but these taco’s were even better. The place was packed but it was a very well run, clean fast food establishment that provided great service. All employees were extremely patient and polite while they answered my daughters questions about the food. My family and I were very impressed. If you’re in the area, Los Tacos is worth a visit. You will not be disappointed. Thank you Los Tacos for a lunch I won’t ever forget! If I ever get back to NYC, I will definitely return.

Dar Moha was our final choice for our last night in Marrakesh, after reading different reviews and looking at their website. The restaurant won't disappoint you, since it is very elegant with a beautiful garden/pool. We had a table by the pool that I have requested. The service was attentive and humorous and the food was up to a certain standards. I did expect however to find a few more nouveau. Overall it was pleasant experience

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We have been to many afernoon teas around London. This is by far the best we have been too. From the man on the door to our server Filipos it was all around a great afternoon. The food was so tasty and there were proper english sandwiches. Great choice of jams. My fav was the rose petal. We didnt feel hurried at all. There was live piano playing in the back around. We got to take home our left over cakes. They were packed up so well in little plastic containers, Other places should copy this as it meant our cakes got home safe and sound. We look forward to our next visit thank you.

review_data.review_title: Excellent food and decor but mob of teenagers outside the restaurant harassing tourists for money ruined the evening.
review_data.review: The food and decor at this place are excellent, with live musicians in the front room. This place is a little gem. It’s very unfortunate that it is hard to find and if you are not accompanied by a guide or a local, you are followed by a mob of very aggressive teenagers who harass and threaten you until you give them money. We had a staff member from the restaurant standing a couple of meters this happened who just watched and did nothing to help. This is frankly appalling from the restaurant staff. The restaurant knows full well that the mob outside is vile and aggressive and they know the place is very hard to find on your own, but they didn’t offer to come pick us up from our Riad or anything when we called to book a table. It’s only when we complained on arrival that they offered that one of the waiters walked us back to our Riad after the meal. We give 1 star just because of this incident. Moroccan police don’t seem to care about these sort of things and the restaurant turns a blind eye. We will never return and we advise people to go either with a taxi or accompanied by a local for safety.

We ordered a pizza quarto and got a pizza with the four individual toppings (mushroom, artichoke, ham, olives) concentrated in each quarter of the pizza. That was weird. We had to redistribute the toppings ourselves to get what we wanted.  The pizza was tasty but the dough was very thin and didn't hold up under the toppings. This a pizza that requires a knife and fork.  Why were we brought a basket of foccacia with the pizza instead of before, to munch on while we were waiting?  The caprese salad consisted of a lot of cut up cherry tomatoes and a big hunk of mozzarella cheese resting on a bed of arugula. It needed balsamic vinegar.  We went because it was so highly rated but I was unimpressed.  The servers are very pleasant. Perhaps they were understaffed the night we went because there were definitely not enough people handling the front of the house.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: I'm not surprised we got the last reservation for dinner though we booked it several days in advance and this is not tourist season. Word is out that they have good food.  My partner and I shared a prawn appetizer. Do Europeans think it's fun for customers to dismember whole prawns, eyeballs and all? It's not! I don't like having to work so hard to get to the edible bits in a restaurant. The prawn flesh was tasty and the lemony garlicky sauce was good enough to eat with a spoon (which I did).  We both ordered the grilled octopus that came with a few thin spears of broccolini and three small whole potatoes. The octopus was perfect. Tender and succulent, with delicious shavings of crispy garlic in the sauce.  We asked for tap water and were given filtered water and charged 1.50 euro. Not a lot but tap water is very drinkable in Lisbon and they should make it available for free.  To compliment the meal we each had a glass of tasty wine, not overpriced at 5 euro a glass.

Now this is what I call great cocktails. We went to one of the top cocktail places in the world in the summer ( the clumsies in Athens) and the cocktails were as good here. I had the apothecary , vodka and gin based with fresh geranium leaf, excellent. Mum had their equivalent of a pina colada. I don’t normally like whisky cocktails but my husbands ‘ marrakech market’ was fabulous. We had sharing plates, all really tasty, of mini burgers, steak with chimchurri, fried octopus. Fantastic designed place too as a speakeasy and wonderful welcome and looked after. So refreshing, It’s these sorts of places that will draw us back to marrakech

review_data.review: We ordered one blu gamburger and taratar steak .both very testy and when in paired with good red winePeyre La gazette it began be excellent. We very liked service of our waitress polite and charming yung woman.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Highly recommend a visit to this oasis. The best time would be for a morning trip to the pool.  The staff are friendly and welcoming.  The restaurant has a 100K min spend. To sit by the pool on a lounger there is a 150K min spend.  The bathrooms are very clean and tidy.  The meals are reasonably priced and decent sizes.  The pool areas is relaxing and peaceful surrounded by nature, blue colours and the sound of birds / a waterfall.  I ordered a tuna steak on ciabatta. Unfortunately the ciabatta was about a day old & the tuna was very dry. Given the bread wasn’t fresh, it make me slightly concerned the fish might not be either. But nevertheless it was a good value meal for 82K. It also came with fries which was unexpected (the menu didn’t say this). Unfortunately the fries hadn’t been cooked long enough and were still that processed harder raw potato in the middle. The fries would be yummier with salt.  I ordered a fruit salad which had a great variety of fruit including banana, strawberries, rock melon, water melon, and delish tasty apple!! It came with yougert, (granola on the top to my surprise) and lime. The bailenese honey was nice and lime flavoured (not too sweet!). The fruit salad could be improved with more lime, dragon fruit included  It would be nice if the menu ultilised the cheaper local sourced ingredients more - ie. the salmon steak at 210K Could be switched to a seared tuna loin at an affordable price around 15K.  It would also be nice if diary free nut milks were available for the coffee.  I would also suggest lowering the price of the fresh young coconut (even at top beach clubs they don’t seem to reach the 50K mark).  I would also suggest the option of adding sides to the breakfasts - especially a side of avo.  The menu could cater better to vegetarians and vegans or healthy eaters by allowing “a make your own” with sides option.  Overall, really impressed with the local and great taste decor. Will be coming back and will recommend to others.  Thanks heaps for a lovely treat of a morning :)

After a very quick and slightly terrifying Uber ride, we needed a drink and bloody quick please. We were not disappointed and were taken to a table overlooking the Main Street. As it was only 7.30pm (Argentinian’s don’t eat until 8 or 9pm) we had the place too ourselves. Leonel our attendant spoke good English so ordering was a breeze. Food and wine are so cheap and of such quality it really only comes down to what your taste buds are up for. Small glasses of Sav were the only disappointment, come on Sheraton catch up to other local restaurants who give you a proper size glass of wine. Anyway the MOW tucked into the biggest chargrilled octopus tentacle I have ever seen and I settled for the braised rabbit, both excellent and of large proportions. Just had to have an excellent red from the Cafayete region, much better than Mendoza reds. Mains were rabbit done in pastry and aged steak accompanied with sweetbreads, hmm not really me...Dessert was a grilled banana in its skin with a caramel sauce and a parfait, bloody delicious. Any way service slowed down as more people arrived and the staff were stretched, however they made up for it by providing an excellent champagne FOC. Well done Leonel.

review_data.review_title: Excellent Afternoon Tea In a lovely environment and outstanding service.
review_data.review: Despite London having moved into the new Tier 2 (High) Covid-19 category, my wife and myself had Afternoon Tea earlier today in the Park Room at the Grosvenor House Hotel on Park Lane.  We arrived a little late but were given a warm welcome by both Andre and Herlyn who were not only expecting us (current bookings are understandably much lower than normal) but provided exceptional service throughout our visit. With only one other table taken, we were soon sitting at one of the nice window tables overlooking Hyde Park.  After taking our Tea (we both opted for English Breakfast) and Jam (Ginger & Rhubarb, Rose Petal and Strawberry) orders, it wasn’t long before our substantial Afternoon Tea (good range of delicious sandwiches, 4 lovely scones and some nice deserts) arrived. There was certainly plenty to eat and what was left was put into a doggy bag together with 2 slices of lemon drizzle cake.  Not only that, we had two pots of Ginger & Lemon Tea before departing by which time it was pleasing to see several other tables having been taken.  All in all, it was a most enjoyable experience - enhanced by both Andre & Herlyn who certainly went the extra mile as far as we were concerned!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Together with 25 other Anglo-Thai Society members, my wife and myself had lunch today at the Sokkhak River Restaurant in Siem Reap.  It is an attractive property with inside and outside seating on two floors. Our Group were allocated a large table on the second floor and both the food and the service were excellent - as indeed was the free WiFi service.  Good also to note that celebrities such as David Beckham have dined there in the past. Well worth a visit.

review_data.review_title: Very Overpriced but Yummy Indian Food
review_data.review: Atmosphere & Service: Excellent service. Very nice staff. Place is decorated heavily with Indian decor.  Food: One thing I noticed is everything is very expensive. Wouldn't mind it as much if the portions were bigger and the food tasted better but it was just fine. We got our typical things like Butter Chicken, a Lamb dish, garlic naan, Aloo gobi, and a baked fish dish. Also disappointed that no entrees come with any rice so you have to order all the rice separately (again, adds to the expenses).  Fish was super dry and not cooked well at all. Butter chicken was good because you can't really mess up butter chicken. Lamb was not tender and a bit dry. Aloo Gobi had good flavors but small portions too.  We tried this place because we were getting a bit tired of the same european flavors and we we wanted to spice it up after 10 days of travel but I was quite disappointed with this place esp this being one of the most expensive meals I had in 10 days of travel.

We were staying nearby last weekend and on reading the reviews thought we would give this cafe a visit. We had breakfast on Saturday morning -both ordering the English breakfast and then returned again on Sunday morning when I swapped to the English Potato hash. Both mornings we received excellent friendly service from our witnessed but Nora also made a point of coming out of the kitchen and chatting to us and making sure everything was ok. T The food was freshly cooked, plentiful and so tasty with a great menu where anyone can get food to eat -there are Turkish and mediterranean choices, healthy, vegan and vegetarians options. On Saturday one table were requesting changes to their breakfast because they eat only halal meat and on Sunday a Jewish gentleman asked for his breakfast to be cooked in a particular way, nothing was too much trouble. Absolutely no faults to be found. I even used the loo upstairs on Sunday and it was immaculately clean. If we lived nearby it would become a local.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: Like so many Cambodians, Tevvy has a sad story so it is great to support her great little restaurant which provides excellent value unpretentious local cooking.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We were suspicious of several Siem Reap restaurants with heavily western menus or a fancy website so were delighted to find Haven with a social purpose. The staff are really charming, the local dishes were delicious - but if you’re missing western food they have tasty options. We hadn’t booked and were lucky to get a table as the pretty garden was packed. The owner is charming and the banana in coconut milk is yummy.

We ate here 3 times during one week... Very reasonably priced, simple and tasty food. Excellent Chicken and Lemon Tajine, pastilla and salads. Friendly and efficient service. The place to go when you just want some good food without a hassle, be it local style or western. Clientele mostly tourists but don’t let it discourage you :)

review_data.review_title: Out of city but worth a visit - alone to support the noble cause...
review_data.review: Reaching NEW HOPE is little bumpy but worth. For me it was a great experience to visit this place. Though I did not have any appointment I was greeted by Mr. Kemsour and he took time to show me what the NGO is doing to make life of poor people from rural areas.  I had lunch and some drink and both were great. There are possibilities to become a sponser of this NGO. The NGO helps those people who are really helpless. I witnessed distribution of rice and other basic groceries to poor people from rural areas. They do keep a watch on families that they do not misuse the donated things.  May God bless New Hope NGO.  By visiting this place you support the NGO!!

This is always more of an event than a place per se. This is my third trip to Buenos Aires and third time visiting this special secret dining room in 16 years. The food is always exceptional and creatively prepared using fresh regional ingredients. Each of 5 courses is described in detail and paired with thoughtfully chosen wines. The chef is incredibly knowledgeable of wines and the stories behind them. His background in some of the best restaurants in New York City offers an interesting perspective. If the food and beverage were not enough, the interactions and friendships made with the guests takes the experience over the top. Everything about the timing and the interactions and the flow of the evening has always seemed to be “just the right amount of everything“. Bravo! (Get there soon as the chef is technically retired but still doing these special events on occasion.)

review_data.review_title: Truly the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires
review_data.review: We had a fantastic time from the moment we arrived. The description of what to expect was precisely accurate. We really enjoyed meeting the other guests but the food was the star of the show. Every dish was attractively presented and absolutely delicious. The portions were perfect if not slightly large but everything was seasoned to perfection. The chef Dan brings vast food knowledge from years of experience, research, and from being a food writer. This is such a special experience that I strongly suggest you book it in advance as to not be disappointed if trying to do so after you arrive in Buenos Aires. When available, Dan also provides food-oriented day tours. We were lucky to spend a full day with him and it enriched our experience immensely as he has lived there for almost 20 years. His Spanish and English are perfect and he speaks several other languages.

Lunch with my daughter after a morning of exploring temples. The ambience is zen garden. The staff are wonderful and the food was yummy. Mainly spring rolls, either fried or fresh. We especially liked the cheese and sundries tomato ones. We spent $14 for lunch for two including two beers and consider it very good value.

The food here was good and the service extremely friendly. However, I would have preferred there to be one dominant cuisine rather than the mix of dishes included here in the Grande set menu (from Indian to Thai). Also felt that there were too many salads, and the selection should have included noodles as well as rice. If you want alcohol, don't forget to bring your own since the restaurant doesn't have a licence. The lemon and lime cheesecake was to die for!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: This restaurant is inside a hotel but there's no hassle going in if you're not staying there. The service and food here were excellent and the views over Hanoi were stunning.

review_data.review_title: Great evening of wine and food
review_data.review: A tiny little restaurant (Italian) tucked away in a small street not far from the river - it only seats about a dozen people - BOOK (well in advance) We tried some divine wines from Puglia and you get to taste before you buy a glass, you get plenty of friendly help and advice on choosing what is right for you and to go with the food you have ordered. The Food - delicious home cooked Italian ‘Tapas’ style dishes - so yummy, we had the Bruschetta, Goats cheese with pine nuts and honey and the aubergine Parmigiana and meatballs - Delicious:0 Home made tiramisu and chocolate pudding accompanied by a dessert wine - mmmmm - an excellent, fun and ‘different’ evening thoroughly enjoyed every moment,mouthful and morcel :) thank you Wine O’clock (Cash Only )

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Lovely place with an amazing and super tasty food! For special occasions is this place perfect. You will feel like a king and queen <3

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: We have been here three times - twice for tapas and drinks at the bar in the evening and once for brunch. Happy hour is good value and the food is delicious. The staff are very friendly and upbeat. Love the decor and spaciousness. Generous wine servings! Brunch was probably forgettable and they were almost empty while other restaurants nearby were overflowing so perhaps they need to rethink the brunch offerings.
Khmer Food preparation is excellent and so is the hospitality. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Especial thanks to Chef, Puthea and Mr Reaksa, for looking after us. Great experience.

review_data.review_title: What a thoroughly delightful, warm welcoming restaurant at extremely fair and reasonable prices tucked away with gorgeous local
review_data.review: What a thoroughly delightful restaurant, hidden away in the narrow streets between Ave Charles de Gaulle and the river, close to our hotel, Tara Angkor. Free tuk-tuk to and from the restaurant, greeted by the warm welcome of young Cambodian waiters and chef, all undergoing their training at this gem of hospitality & warmth. The prices were very reasonable, including wines, and food exquisite.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: The friendliest most attentive Restaurant in Siem Reap!
review_data.review: Well where do we start? The service! We were treated like kings and queens by all the staff, especially Bopha, Sokun and Pon, who could not have been more attentive. The food was contemporary with a local Khmer touch. After quite some nights previously of enjoying a host of Cambodian dinners and meals, which we loved by the way, we chose this evening to opt for some Australian and Cambodian steaks which were cooked to perfection! The food was reasonably priced, as were the drinks. Thoroughly recommend and a memorable evening

I found this restaurant on TA / the reviews are very good and decided to try one of it’s Khmer stir fry dishes the menu is varied and has Khmer, Thai and some western food choices as well. The chicken stir fry was excellent - lots of fresh veggies and lots of really nice breast of chicken. The sauce was great, thanks - will be back again .

This is another amazing social profit enterprise. They take in disadvantaged youth. They train, educate, coach and mentor young adults to be self-sustaining and employed in today’s world. They also run a 1st class restaurant with excellent food, ambience and incredible customer service. Thank You for what you do.

They take in disadvantaged youth - train them in life skills, work skills, hospitality management - being servers, cooks , chefs , managers etc. Then trainees are sent out to other hotels for internships and then after graduation they all find jobs in the local Siem Reap hospitality industry. A remarkable process. Train your staff well and they will look after your customers.

This restaurant is a dream and a Haven for dis-advantaged youth. Paul and his wife ( owners) started this project in order to provide youth with an opportunity to acquire life, work and employment skills. Youth go through an internship process for a number of months. When they graduate they are hired at local high-end restaurants as they have excellent hospitality skills, knowledge abilities. So, when in Siem Reap you will have to eat , so I ask that you dine at this restaurant support their cause.
Simply amazing menu choices - super fresh, healthy, wholesome, delicious and great customer service. Whoo Hoo I highly recommend this restaurant

we always stop in and have dinner or lunch @ Tevy’s Place. Tevy and her staff are so welcoming. Excellent service and menu choices at a very reasonable price. She brings in and trains young women in all aspects of running a restaurant. Thanks for being a successful entrepreneur and for training, coaching and mentoring young adults.

I love this restaurant. The food was s 12/10 , interesting ambience, great staff and excellent customer service . If you sit a front you can watch them cook your meal. All female staff. This place is another social profit enterprise. Tevy supports educational programs for disadvantaged youth - specifically females in Siem Reap. She deserves the Order of Cambodia. Pucs to follow

simply an amazing restaurant. Here is another example of a social profit agency that works the restaurant business and puts $$$ back into the community. You just have to go there. The food, music, decor, ambience and customer service is Outstanding.

As I said it was Ok, not Oh Woo Hoo amazing like the other reviewed. Now that being said It was mid afternoon and I stopped for chicken satay as an appies and had a glass of red vine. The server showed me the bottle and I reviewed the label as I held the bottle. What I was served was a cold glass of wine. It either not what he showed me or an opened bottle that was in The fridge. Somewhat disappointing. The satay presentation was good - but the chicken was chewy and lacked a proper seasoning. The service was very good.
This restaurant has fantastic atmosphere, and delicious, authentic Greek food. One of my favourite restaurants in London.
Great food. Fab service from Greta. Will come again Strongly recommend. Two course lunch great value at £9.50
