review_data.review_title: Dim Sum and traditional Chinese Food, great quality, great service
review_data.review: We visited the small restaurant in Soho NYC. Excellent quality, fast service and wonderful taste. Cash only. Seats/tables are a bit small but the menu and the food presentation is great.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review_title: Very popular local restaurant. Book your table!
review_data.review: We ate dinner here. It’s a cozy restaurant in Firostefani and an alternative to the caldera view restaurants because it relies on ambience and food more than caldera views. Certainly a very welcoming and helpful host and this place is rightly popular. We had booked in advance and that was a good job because there were many ad hoc visitors who had to be turned away as it was fully booked. The food is very homely and of a good standard. I am not sure where many reviewers below have dined but I would not consider the food rates as highly as many have described. Obviously tastes vary. We found it a very pleasant alternative though to many other places we visited in Santorini and it certainly comes at a significantly lower cost than pretty much anywhere with the view out over the caldera. Well worth a visit . But don’t forget to book, they are very helpful

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Ambience, nice. Staff, very friendly. Toilet, clean.  Ordered a pottery kebab. Staff undoubtedly put on a great show, big fire. Wow!!! We were impressed. The food inside? Not nice. Mainly visited by tourists who should try other genuine Pottery kebab (that needs to be cooked inside for several hours, therefore need advanced order). We tried it in Cappadocia, we had to order it at least 3hr in advance. It was yummy.  Had lamb shank, it was hard. Even the knife couldn’t cut thru the meat.  Did we enjoy it? No. Do we recommend it? No.  It was very pricey too (for the quality of the food they served).

The ambience is so perfect for couple. You can enjoy the the delicious foods with elegant music. The desserts are too good to be true. You should try chocolate mousse! I think the chocolate mousse is the best one in Ubud or even in Bali!

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: If you are American (as am I), I advise you to just relax and enjoy. The chef prepares wonderful dishes - subtle flavors, beautiful presentations. The matre d' covers the entire (small) floor, but he knows what he is doing and pairs wine well. I do recommend going with the wine pairing. So just relax, enjoy the meal, it should take a while because it is wort it.

review_data.review_title: Downstairs cafe more of a snack bar
review_data.review: On New Years Day, a Sunday, many restaurants were closed or full but we managed to get a table at this place, just off the main square.  It was busy, with a good atmosphere, and friendly service - good prices but felt more like a snack bar with cool decor in it´s vibe, which will be perfect for some diners as they also offer a variety of meals including sandwiches, paninis, pizzas, burgers and chips.  We shared Moroccan salads (the falafels were very dry), Briouate and Chicken Pastilla which we enjoyed more in other places - but the chicken skewers and chicken wrap were enjoyed by our teenagers.  To be fair, it was only 340DH for a family of five, which was good value.

Perhaps our best restaurant experience in Lisbon. First of all, Ricardo who was servicing our table was very friendly, supportive, patient and professional. Whatever we tried and tasted there was really tasty and delicious. We were group of 6 people so I won't go into details of each dish. But my dish, the Filetto 68Q al Gorgonzola (photo below) was very tasty and also I won't forget the Panna Cotta dessert I tasted at Come Prime, one of the best. Fantastic value, food and atmosphere, and what else one really need?

review_data.review_title: A place if you want to step up your dining
review_data.review: If you had enough of the hyper local dining experience, this is a great place to be. Prices per dish are somewhere around 6-12$, which yes it's much more than what you pay for on the streets, but once again the price is justified with the taste, atmosphere and services. The restaurant staff Sros had helped to organize a super last minute birthday celebration for one of us and was very attentive! Of course, even without the birthday surprise it was still worth every single penny!

We accepted gladly the suggested set menu. Excellent tastes and presentation, very pleasantly served by the professional staff. Contents of all courses were thoroughly explained, and even allergies were well handled. Definately recommended!

One of the best restaurants we visited during our vacation. Nice view over Hanoi, very good food, cool and relaxed atmosphere, but most of all an extremely friendly and helpful staff! Thanks to all, but mostly to our special friend Chucc Chucc!

We had an excellent rewarding cooking class experience together with Chef Ton! First visiting the local market and the beautiful old temple next to it. Then back at the hotel we prepared a papaya salad, a coconut chicken soup and finally a massaman beef curry, guided by the chef. Our ten months old baby boy was taken care of by the whole staff. The self-prepared lunch was yummie and we all enjoyed a lovely time. Thank you!

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: I enjoyed most. This is the best place. I liked food and also the service was great. I highly recommend. The Dishes come out very perfectly and decorative.

How refreshing to find this intimate restaurant in busy Manhattan. We got there at 6 pm on a Saturday evening- the first to arrive. We didn’t have reservations. By the time we left at 7 pm, the place was full! My daughter and I ordered several appetizers including spring rolls, samosas, raita, and garlic naan then split an entree— chicken vindaloo. Everything was so tasty and spicy! Our server was great and honored us with two other items— a complimentary sample appetizer and dessert! With two glasses of wine, our bill was $56–what a deal to get such authentic Indian food in New York City. Friendly service here —can’t wait to come back!

We did have a reservation but there were plenty of seats at the bar so, you guessed it, we sat there. It was an excellent experience from the start. We were greeted by two friendly bartenders who started out being attentive and engaging and ended that way too! Standouts were Escargot Bread, Duck confit and Espresso martini

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Picked this place on our first night in Siem Reap based on the excellent TA Reviews - they are spot on! Service and food both delightful!  They picked us up and dropped us off for free from our hotel (we tipped the Tuk Tuk driver though)  The dining room looks as good as the photos and staff are all lovely - smiling and attentive.  Cocktails at $3.25 was too good to miss!  Nice little Spring Roll amuse bouche.  Starters of Fried Noodles and Vegetable Fritters we’re fresh and flavoursome. (6 large fritters)  Mains of Vegetarian Curry and Pan Grilled Beef Steak Lok Lak Style - both delicious!  Lovely home made ice cream and coffee to finish. ($36 + Tip)

Art Shadow Restaurant made for a pleasant evening with family. The service and level of hospitality was second to none. The willingness to swap and change the menu to suit was very much appreciated. The dance show was brief but again pleasant and easy to watch while eating dinner. The food was acceptable and certainty edible in most parts ( except the soup) Highlight was the cocktails.  All in all a pleasant evening that will not break the bank.  TIP: ensure your Tuk Tuk drivers waits or comes back for you. There are no Tuk tuks that hang around the site after the show so you could get stuck.

Lots of really good restaurants on Tapul road and this is one of them. Great prices, selection and quality, I had the chicken cordon bleu and it was delicious. Huge portion and great value. Service is excellent

It has been 10 years since my last visit to Buenos Aires and Casa Saltshaker was on my must do list. It was just as much an incredible experience as I remembered in my previous three visits. Each time I have been I have really enjoyed visiting with other guests from around the world. Even though I am not the most social person, I have felt very comfortable with this experience. Dan and Henry make everyone feel at home. The food is superb and the wine pairings are excellent. In addition it is a great place to share your current travel experiences and obtain excellent advice and recommendations.

I am giving this 4 stars because of the wonderful service. However in my experience the food was disappointing. This trip I am trying to eat a bit healthier ordering vegetable plates along with steak. The vegetables were overcooked and visually unappealing. The salad I ordered was drenched with way too much salad dressing. When I arrived the restaurant was empty but when leaving it was full.
On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.
Wonderful. Lemon grass is used for a very unique straw for drinks. Food and service are excellent. Delicious soup and roasted eggplant with pork. Can’t wait to return to try other dishes.
We stayed at the hotel for a week and loved every meal we had at Seminyak Kitchen. The service was exceptional as well. There is a varied menu with all dishes cooked perfectly.

review_data.review_title: Pricey Breakfast Buffet Doesn't Deliver Enough
review_data.review: While the ~$31 breakfast buffet offers many food choices, anything fine one would expect on an equivalent buffet was lacking. No smoked salmon, prosciutto, better cold-cuts, no carving station. No beef of any sort. The only cheeses provided were factory-type Gouda and cheddar. Eggs Benedict & Eggs Florentine had sat out so long the Hollandaise had congealed. The staff were excellent and the cleanliness and safety standards were all well-observed, but the type of food choices really need to be raised to a higher level.
Great Mexican cuisine. great service. Very good lactation next to swimming pool. Special thanks to Marc

review_data.review_title: Most incredible dining experience in 25 years!
review_data.review: When the tour company booked us for dinner at Steaks by Luis in Buenos Aires, I had no idea it would be this incredible. We arrived at the restaurant just before 8 pm - a locked door with no signage or indication of what was to follow. We were handed a glass of sparkling white wine and met our fellow diners and set out on a gastronomic journey over the next three hours. A five course meal with exquisite wine pairings from, where else, but Mendoza. There is only one sitting, with a maximum of 8 guests all sharing stories and great food cooked, or grilled, to perfection. This was a dining experience, not just a meal.
We had lunch here on a our at this resort. We thought food was very average and very overpriced. Also service wasn't great either. Not that impressed, as La Sala was excellent.
We had such a fun night when we visited Benihana. The food, service and entertainment were excellent. We loved our visit.

How on earth can you charge 21 dollars for a Margherita? I am italian and I know how much pizza costs to make. I also know that outside Italy pizza can be very "posh" but this is robbing people. Never again

I visited this restaurant in june of this year Even though the sous chef had a problem they honor my reservation and the service was incredible this small place with limited seating (in my experience this has the advantage of more intimate meal and it forces the chef to make every dish special) the food is full of creativity and the tasting menu has the best quality price relation in paris. this is a well balanced menu and you don't end up hungry or excessively full.  The chef was super nice and when i wanted to know the name of and ingredient he tipped for me in my phone.  we tried to come back before leaving paris and it wasn't posible fully booked for the week so this restaurant is a new reason to comeback in 2018. i hope this restaurant continues to evolve and gain the recognition it deserves i can see a michelin star approaching

After our first visit last year, we went back to this amazing restaurant this time with some friends, the service has improve greatly and the food keeps getting more surprising and innovative, i really think that a michelin star is due to this incredible place, unfortunately we won't be coming back next year but i hope to be back in 2020 and to see the evolution of a really talented chef.

Just wow! These tacos are as authentic as they could possibly be. For Cinco de Mayo I had to have tacos, and this little place just off Times Square was perfect. Very quick, reasonably priced and so so tasty. They prepare all orders fresh in front of you.

Probably the best views in Istanbul.  Drinks are not that pricey for the kind of amazing place that it is. Best place for some well earned Sundowners.  I must mention Mohammaed who was very attentive and made his effort to make good our most requests. Now that’s what you call good service.  The DJ plays a good relaxed mix early evening then sets the groove as night sets in  Must visit if you are in Istanbul

The creme brulee with pineapple is the best! Friendly and efficient staff. The Manager Christopher speak french as well, makes it easier to order. Easy to find on the corner of W 45 St and 5th Avenue.

A friend who grew up in Dubai took me to Gazebo this week. It is by all accounts a bit of an institution and I can see why. Great kebabs, juicy chicken and excellent bread and biryani. Will definitely return

Gazebo is one of the best Indian restaurants in UAE. Their food is good and services equally good. The menu covers a wide variety of dishes with good selection for vegetarians. Bindi do Pyaza is one of my favourites.Children love their Paneer tikka. Prices are reasonable. Deira City Centre for me is the best location.

review_data.review_title: TREAT Your self To the Regional tasting menus 👌out of this world 🌎
review_data.review: Excellent staff 🕺🏻💃sublime food👩‍🍳👨‍🍳 and perfect cocktails 🍸🥂it really doesn’t get much better than this 👌👌😘

review_data.review_title: Best kitchen and front of house team in London with out a doubt 👌👌👌👌👌
review_data.review: I’ve been eating in the top restaurants in London and Europe for coming on for 30 years and I have never come across a more well oiled Team than at Theo’s the core members and you all no who your are are very efficient,polite and extremely knowledgeable from being greeted like a family member to the perfect cocktails to the best wine pairings and definitely some of the best put together menus I’ve had the privilege of eating Thank you all for a lovely Christmas absolutely perfect x

review_data.review_title: Outstanding Italian food at its best 👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👨‍🍳
review_data.review: I’ve been eating here for several months now trying all the different regional menu’s that change each month taking you on a food journey around Italy without having to get on a plane. Just a shame you don’t get the suntan with it But you certainly get the best cocktails and the best value for money for the service,food and drink OUTSTANDING  The À la carte menu has an abundance of good choices they really get the taste buds going and the wine pairings really finish off the dishes to bring out the best . I don’t think you would find any high end restaurant in London that have a really really good core TEAM of people as they do here keep up the good work your all amazing.

This was like watching an opera / Orchestra the way the team at the front worked together lead by one of the best maitre d’s that I’ve seen all the staff gliding around the floor taking orders and bringing out the food and drink lead by a master of her craft As for the food WOW the pasta was like eating silk with the richest Ragu the best comfort food ever Thanks so much to Mr Theo Randall for taking the time out for a chat and signing a couple of his cook books for me it really made my birthday All I can say is I can’t wait to come back TOTALLY AMAZING ‍

review_data.review_title: Good food good service at a fair price
review_data.review: We stopped in for lunch after a full morning seeing the sites We were greeted by Olena who showed us to a table We were so well looked after by her anything we needed no problem I enjoyed a Burger and chips enjoyed our visit hope to get back if there is time

Without a doubt, the BEST meal in our 5-day trip to Siem Reap. The restaurant serves a 6-course set meal (no a la carte) and the menu changes monthly. We loved every single course, except for 1 of the main course (of pork, which was a bit dry). But every other course was amazing - full of delicious flavours, fresh ingredients and always a refreshing take on traditional Khmer cuisine, infused with modern cooking techniques. My favourite was the dessert - a fusion of western and Asian flavours - ice cream, and traditional cakes from Asia.  The restaurant is also beautifully furnished and the wait staff were attentive and responsive. At the end of our meal, one of the chefs came out to meet us and was open to our feedback about the pork course. They also gave us a box of 2 macarons each, which were really delicious (note that i'm really particular about macarons).  Overall, a most wonderful dining experience in Siem Reap.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We had our first meal in Siem Reap here. And had Crispy Sticky Rice with ‘Natang’ Sauce and Fish Amok. We enjoyed both dishes which were curry-based and went really well with rice. As it was our first Cambodian meal, we were very sure what to expect. While i found both dishes a little salty, there were both nonetheless delicious.

We were staying in Queenstown and had lunch at this venue at Steamers Wharf.  The view from our table was great towards the lake.  Service was attentive and friendly from our male servers.  I had the Sirloin with creamy peppercorn sauce and my wife had the Lamb Skewers. We shared a eye fillet salad.  All of our meals were excellent.

review_data.review_title: Food was good but service was poor
review_data.review: We dined at this Thai Restaurant when visiting Queenstown.  Nice venue and our table overlooked the street below.  I ordered a shared Seafood Tom Yum , Coconut Prawns and a Tiger Beer.  I waiting some time and my drink hadn’t arrived so I followed it up. She had forgotten??  Our Tom Yum arrived and it was large and very good. The Coconut Prawns we ordered had not arrived and this was also followed up. She said this wasn’t ordered? My wife and I heard the order made.  So the order taking left a lot to be desired.  We finished off with fried banana and ice cream which was a huge serve.

Thank you TA, I read the reviews and we visited a couple of days ago... the 95dh menu was amazing value, I had the pastille which was so tasty, followed by the kofta tagine, which was just right, my husband had the chicken couscous which was huge.... all nicely served and piping hot. The staff were attentive and friendly and we sat outside for a great atmosphere... even the tiny WC was clean and fresh smelling, not always the case in Morocco!  I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant and will visit again...

Visited twice during a fantastic stay at the Anantara Villas. Food very good and staff excellent. Great service and attention. Had steak on the first night which was average and lamb on the second which was excellent. Also had butter fish for the first time which was extremely nice and tuna cooked on a salt brick which we wished we had ordered rare as it kept cooking and ended up medium well. The salt theme is interesting but a bit over the top. Good selection of wines at typical high prices. Reastaurant is next to the beach but not really a sea view restaurant. Very good food excellent staff and definitely worth a visit.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: So when you arrive you pick where you want to be seated and what type of seating , lounge in pool , on edge , hammock etc. You prepay a minimum spend for the seat. Then you order food and drinks. Area very nice and staff were excellent. Location great . Food was good and drinks were cold  Make sure you allow enough time to hit your minimum spend.

review_data.review_title: what we like and did not like
review_data.review: right after a 1-hour yoga session, we had a great breakfast by the sea. the service strives to be excellent but some junior staff does not really know how to serve properly. the view and atmosphere are amazing. the quality of the coffee could be improved for that price. overall excellent experience
great dining experience if you can afford it. the 6-course dinner is lovely. french cuisine at its best.

review_data.review_title: Flavor Sensation - Thai Cuisine at its Best
review_data.review: The food and service at JW Marriott Resort and Spa Ginja Restaurant is exceptionally good. The Sea Bass Fillet with Chili and Lime is fresh and delicate and the slow cooked Beef Massaman Curry is mouthwatering delicious. The manager,Khun Lek, along with her team, and the newly appointed chef provide an exceptional dining experience.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;History Buff;Nature Lover

review_data.review_title: Fabulous Indian food in the heart of New York
review_data.review: We visited for dinner one evening in New York while n holiday and had a great meal. We chose a vegetable biryani, dhal and baigan barga and it was all delicious! Friendly staff and nice decor too.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

We had dinner on a busy Thursday night in December. Our entrees were awesome; fresh grilled fish and with tasty veggies, cooked to perfection.  Despite the busy hour our meals were served promptly. Service is excellent. Il Punto is decorated in a festive holiday theme, which only adds to the charming atmosphere.  While there’s tons of good restaurants in the Theatre District, Il Punto is the equal to any of them and a good location close to Penn Station. Put it on your list !

review_data.review_title: Great Khmer Food at very reasonable prices
review_data.review: This is a new Siem Reap restaurant recommenced to us by a local. Offering Khmer street food with a twist, plated like a 5 star restaurant.  Started with the Siem Reap Platter for 2, followed by Prawn Salad & Battambang sausage. All really tasty. Also had a “fresh & tasty” cocktail which was superb and the Australian Chardonnay was also good  We ate early (6.30) so were the only ones there.  Service was great, with each dish explained by Nab the owner, and he introduced the two other staff on that night doing the cooking.  This is our 3rd visit to Siem Reap so we have eaten at a lot of places. Will definitely be going back to this one.

review_data.review_title: Excellent degustation dinner with wine pairing
review_data.review: I visit Paris annually in summer and make sure to always enjoy one dinner at Jean-Francois Rouquette's restaurant pur. Soon after my arrival I contacted the concierge to make a booking for me. At that point in time unfortunately no table was available anymore and I was offered to join the waitlist or make a booking at another restaurant. Luckily, I joined the waitlist which within 24 hours confirmed the booking. My friends and I ended up dining at the chef's table, which can be separated from the restaurant by curtains and provides a more romantic dining experience. We chose Chef Rouquette's 8 course diary tasting menu and wine pairing which was an excellent choice.
Casual lunch/brunch place on the lake. Playing good music! Enjoyed able and relaxing. Mozzarella salad, focaccia, sangria - all were good.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Spot on location, right beside Tower Bridge. Very helpful, friendly waitress. Perfect bar to relax in, lovely surroundings. Good choice of drinks, in fact struggled to decide!

Every dish was delicious. Service was excellent and the wine served with the tasting menu was superb. Can't believe the very reasonable price. When you arrive by taxi, it looks like you're at an abandoned store. Ring the doorbell, and you'll be admitted by the smiling hostess. This was truly one of our finest dining experiences in South America. If I lived in B.A., I would dine here whenever the menu changed.

This was a pleasant and unexpected surprise: the food was absolutely delicious and beautifully prepared using wonderful ingredients. The quail stuffed with duck meat was a very interesting presentation and truly sublime. Overall, it was a perfect dinner with outstanding service. I will definitely recommend this restaurant for gourmets or for a special romantic dinner. We will definitely be back for another exceptional meal. This restaurant should definitely be in line for a Michelin star.

We really enjoyed our dining experience at Blue Wagon. The food is very good, not quite the standard of Mlynec or Bellevue, but at half the price. The foie gras is highly recommended, ir was served on a slice of blueberry bread and was delicious. Very friendly staff, which enhanced the experience. Will visit this restaurant again. Highly recommended if you want a good meal at a reasonable price.

We took a chance to try and make a booking last minute and were lucky. Had an absolutely lovely evening, the food and cocktails were amazing in this little oasis of calm and tranquility in the busy city. Totally worth a stop whilst in Siem Reap.

user_data.user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Was recommended by a friend to visit The Bunker and it didn’t disappoint. Bar staff were fantastic and made us feel at home straight away. Vibe is great (although a few ‘snooty’ people obviously frequent this place after work!). We sat at the bar, watched the bar staff work their magic with cocktails and chatted to various other visitors. Ordered an assortment of cocktails and generally had a very pleasant evening!! Lovely fire and intimate setting. Would def go back Note that we were in the upstairs part (I think that there is a restaurant bar downstairs as well..)

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Spoiled for life - best steaks ever!!
review_data.review: Due to a change of plans, we had to find a restaurant for my dad's birthday in NY on that night, after some research I booked a table online and was very happy to still get a table. The waiters were nice and attentive and gave us the time we needed to explain my non-english-speaking parents the menu. Then the waiter came with a plate with the different kinds of meat and they all just looked amazing. We took 2 x the filet steak and 2 x the Ribeye, we wanted to take side dishes per person, but the waiter advised us, to only go with two side dishes - which was a very good advise, because the steaks were quite big, we couldn't even finish the side dishes. And the meat - let me tell you - it was amazing! it was perfectly grilled, it was tender, juicy and so tasty! They also have a broad selection of wines, which vary in price ranges - we took a bottle of a Malbec for around 30USD I think, which was absolutely worth it. The evening was an outstanding experience, food and service wise. We ended up going to K Rico another time during our 5 days in New York and we would fly to New York again, just to eat the steaks!
I visited the restaurant in October 2022. Apart from the excellent view, it offered excellent food, very nice staff and a relaxing atmosphere

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review_title: Nice place, nice staff, nice food and nice price
review_data.review: One of my friend told me to try La Cantine des Gazelles, and i did it ! I really Thanks my Marrocan friend who told me good things about this amazing restaurant. The staff is so helpful and the food is just amazing. I highly recommend the restaurant, we tried the chicken couscous, and it was incredible :)

It was my 60th birthday and we celebrated in style. Food was amazing and the staff very helpful. I was treated to a signature cocktail by the staff. I would certainly go back. Very reasonably priced. Well worth a visit

review_data.review_title: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Ask for Jenny!
review_data.review: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Nice atmosphere with a mix of locals and tourists. We got a walk in table no problem.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Delicious food. Excellent value. Get the Passion Fruit Margarita!
review_data.review: Delicious food. Super friendly. The BEST Passion Fruit Margarita I’ve ever had! Lovely atmosphere. Excellent value.

review_data.review_title: Pleasant food in a lovely location with good service.
review_data.review: We stopped here for some lunch in the scorching heat. I have some veal and the wife had carbonara. Both were tasty without being large portions. Three different staff asked if we wanted desserts. It was decent food for a decent price.

A friend and myself came here for dinner, we were met with a friendly lady and shown to a table, even though we had no reservation.  We sat outside and the views of the fountains were the best I've ever seen. The service was impeccable, I'm gluten intolerant and the waited (Ronnie) was so helpful. Letting me know what I could eat ect. All the staff who spoke to us had a general interest in us.  The food however is the main show stopper here!! Amazing!! Can't say it enough, the steak was cooked to perfection, creamy mash and the mushrooms I could smell before they were on my plate.  I can't wait to come back for another meal.

I met Chef Moha while doing Masterchef Maroc and of course I visited his restaurant, a unique place to appreciate the excellence of Moroccan cuisine. A charming place with family service. A hug Chef Moha.

We went here for office get together lunch & I had a good experience. The food is good and comparable to what we find back in good restaurants back home in India. There was variety & both veg & non-veg food was good. For main course, it was a buffet. The ambiance was good & the staff was courteous. Overall, good Indian treat in New York

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We had a great christmas dinner there, thank you to the owner and his staff to deal with all the customers at the same time.  Good food, great pumpkin soup and caramal ice cream. :)  If i may suggest, would be nice to have air conditioning inside and close the front window doors as it gets hot inside.  Recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Best homemade foie gras in Patong
review_data.review: The café de Paris restaurant is open again in Patong. They have the best homemade foie gras in Phuket. Made by Alain the french chef. The beef tartare is also very good.

review_data.review_title: Very good Australian stirloin in patong
review_data.review: Very good restaurant for meat, duck or burger with australian meat. The Australian stirloin is great. Friendly staff. The chef is very professional and welcoming. Prices are net, all included and located on beach road.

review_data.review_title: Alain the best chef in patong
review_data.review: They had a gigot d'agneau party. Amazing food. Very good gratin dauphinois. Dessert was great too, cheese cake. Don't miss this restaurant in patong.

review_data.review_title: Still the best french restaurant in Patong!
review_data.review: Back at the Café de Paris, still the best french food in patong.  Alain the French Chef makes sure that the customers are happy and enjoy his food.  I recommend the foie gras of course, the duck, and the desserts, friendly staff, give it a try!

The best restaurant in Patong, don't look anywhere else, the food is fantastic.  I enjoy good food and i can tell you that this place is the best in patong thanks to Chef Alain who is passionate about food, cooking and making his customers happy! And Georges makes sure everything is going ok during your meal.  We had homemade foie gras, delicious, duck with pinot noir sauce, very very good, panna cotta, so good and homemade too!!  They gave us some complimentary homemade macarons, very good too, everything was good.  Chef Alain is amazing and makes everything himself!  Don't miss this restaurant if you are in Patong, amazing food to eat and delicious desserts!
Nice restaurant in rawai to eat french food and good cuisine cooked by a french chef. On Tuesday they have a burger party, all you can eat burgers. Staff is nice and friendly.
Professional and friendly staff at zen eat. The chef makes very good food and desserts. If you like burgers, don't miss the burger party on Tuesdays.
Great little place to visit with friends for a drink. The cocktail menu is exciting and the cocktails themselves do not disappoint. Great atmosphere and reasonably priced.

Had a great meal at Steaks by Luis. We were joined by five other diners at a communal table and the food, ambiance and service were great.  Upon arrival you're presented with a class of champagne and offered a selection of bread, cheese and meats. Once everyone arrived, you're brought into the dining room facing the open kitchen and windows that look out onto a terrace where Luis is preparing the wood grill. Before the first course, the fresh cuts of meat and cheese are presented and explained.  Each of the four courses are paired with a local wine which is generously (and continuously), poured. There was so much food and the delicious steaks were so huge that no one was able to finish everything beyond the salad course. I found the $75 per person price more than reasonable given the quality and quantity of both the food and wine.  Steaks by Luis is a closed door restaurant so you must make reservations in advance. Our email inquiry made on the website was responded to promptly.  It's easy to see why Steaks by Luis is one of the highest rated restaurants in Buenos Aires. Luis and his staff take great pride in what they do and it shows in every way.

The concierge at Hotel Edison recommended this restaurant, which is easily walked to from Times Square, when we asked for good, authentic Indian restaurants in New York City. As we approached the restaurant my lovely wife noted that it looked somewhat intimate and quaint. Apparently we thought the bar area was the restaurant, and were soon escorted up to the spacious dining room. We were seated at a window and offered menus. The service was great, but the food fell short of expectations, and was very pricey. Our neighbor makes samosas and shares them with the neighborhood, and we expected the same authenticity at Ustav. Unfortunately, the flavors and textures were not there. I ordered the butternut squash soup, which was delicious, but the chicken tikka masala did nothing for me, nor did the kulfi, which I found to be almost too frozen to cut into and more a savory dish than a dessert. The prices were quite high and we did not leave with a good taste in our mouths, literally and figuratively. Next time we will try one of the smaller (and hopefully less expensive) restaurants.
After seeing the reviews we decided to pop in, we were not disappointed the meal and wine were very reasonable,but 120tl for a beer was too much.
My US friends and myself would come here at least one a week! Meals with naan or rice under $10 and quick, great service. Loved their spicy veggies.

Visited this restaurant after reviewing best restaurants in Prague on Trip Advisor.  Absolutely brilliant. Pleasant staff, lovely surroundings, food awesome. My wife had the wild boar and I had the duck with raspberry, what a wonderful taste on both meals. The waiter recommended a lovely red wine (Roučí 2008, Stapleton-Springer, Bořetice) which complimented the food really well.  For dessert we shared the cheeses and fig board which again was splendid. Followed by tea and coffees.  All this came to under £45 for the two of us.  We enjoyed the experience so much we went back the following day and had the beef wellington and saddle of rabbit, again excellent! Would thoroughly recommend this restaurant to anyone

Found this place on Tripadvisor, when we first got there about 8pm on w Wednesday the place was empty and I didn't want to go in but we did and it turned out to be very good. There's a great value set menu and the food comes fairly quickly. the host was friendly and the setting is nice.  Only downside was a couple of ants on the tables and the walls which I didn't see till after we'd eaten.

Super efficient, polite & easy to deal with for delivery to a Villa in my case. All done via WhatsApp & paid cash when delivery arrived. Delivery super efficient & burgers, fries, chicken wings all really good. Family all happy & content.

Comfortable and pleasant place. Food is well presented and tasty. Very relaxed beachside vibe. Live music not too obtrusive but also engaging. Compact but decent wine list too. Helpful and friendly staff.
What a find. Excellent food & presented very well. Kind & attentive staff. Good value. Recommended. Book to be safe.
We were taken by a local friend who was a regular there. food was good , service also fine, packed and had to wait , overall good.

We booked this from the UK as part of our weekend. On arrival and throughout our entire experience the service as superb. Staff are very attentive and the accompaniments to the cocktails are very funny and a great piece of theatre. The food portions are huge My lobster bisque was delicious followed by a great burger cooked to perfection. My cocktail was custom made after I described what I liked and it was a,axing, and strong! Overall a superb experience well worth it The toilets were, as fitting for this sort of venue, immaculate.

Interestingly quirky laid out restaurant with delightful and friendly staff. The quirkiness continues with a board with multiple choices for designing your own menu. We chose the chef’s own taster menu, as is our normality and we trusted his choices. From the amuse bouche to the mint leaf tea, we were regained with superb dishes exquisite flavours and stunning presentation. Reading the history of the place, chef was bought in to seek to restore their Michelin star, from what we observed he is well on the road to that. The greatest surprise to us was the celeriac course. I must confess some hesitation as I don’t find it the most inspiring ingredient, but his take on it was brilliant with genuinely impressive flavours The trout was very gently and carefully presented with subtlety. The grouse was equally thoughtfully presented. One genuine stand out was the amazing yuzu dessert with a very playful presentation. It’s slightly disingenuous to pick out any favourites as that somehow suggests others are less worthy! We genuinely were hugely impressed with all aspects of this experience and we wish them in their journey back to the top

We booked a table at this small restaurant based on the amazing reviews, but the experience was underwhelming. They had a nice selection of wines, but the waiter never bothered recommending us anything no matter how much we described the type of wine we liked. We ended up having some okayish Czech wine of which they had several shelves of and tries some really bad one after which we moved to Italian wines.  The restaurant is very atmospheric and the food is indeed cooked in front of you and burrata caprese salad was amazing and the cheeses were good, but the rest of the meals were rather average. Not sure if this was an off night, but we did not experience the great tastes everybody is writing about. We even decided to have dessert somewhere else.

review_data.review_title: great food , good size of dish
review_data.review: Fantastic biryanis & kebabs. Best for Tandoori dishes. Service slow but food well cooked. Waiters could be more friendly & polite ! Be prepared to wait on week ends.. definite visit !
I wanted to treat myself to a nice dinner after a long day of travel and Damnak didn't disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious and the staff were so friendly and attentive. Thank you!

We were in Siem Reap for several days. This was without a doubt our best restaurant experience, and they were all ( except for one ) quite good. The Greek atmosphere was delightful, the food was superb and the service impeccable. We were three people. We ordered two Moussakas, 1 small (good size) Greek salad and spanokopita. Truly the best ever Moussaka I've had. Add in an imported beer and the tab came in. in the low 30's. Highly recommended.

review_data.review_title: A Taste of India at its Best
review_data.review: Craving for a real authentic and well made Indian food? This is the place. My own Indian colleagues attest that the food here rivals even the good restaurants in Mumbai. Is it the authenticity of the flavor or the way the meal is freshly prepared? I think it is the passion and the love of the food that makes it very special. To top it off, the very warm and welcoming service makes it a total package.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: As part of a fishing party to Rio Grande we had a stop either end in Buenos Aires and each time dined at this wonderful restaurant. The variety of quality steaks was great, the Malbec was superb and the waiting staff were excellent. Highly recommended and will return.

review_data.review_title: The prior Trip Advisor Reviews are accurate!
review_data.review: While visiting Thailand, one has to eat the best Thai food, and of course, we looked at Trip Advisor to acquire its patrons' opinions. This restaurant rated No. 1, and had raving reviews. Given that, my husband, adult daughter and I decided to give Thong Dee, located in Kathu, relatively close to our hotel, a try. It is a relatively small restaurant located off the main road on what appears to be a neighborhood street. Given its size, I would recommend reservations, although we had no trouble making a last minute 7:30 p.m. on a Friday night. Our server was Patrick, and he could not have been nicer and knowledgeable about the food and wine choices, which are fairly ample (mostly Australian and New Zealand) and inexpensive for Thailand. From appetizers (my daughter and I had oysters and husband spring rolls) to our main course, the food was excellent! The wines were (New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and Shiraz) were paired well. The meal was well worth the money and time getting there, and service excellent. For us, it is a must to visit again the next time we are in Phuket.

We shared a table with another couple and had food served to us very quickly. The frantic pace of the place makes one feel a bit rushed and overwhelmed. Nice food and drink but the hectic ambiance can be overwhelming.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Great meal this evening. Lovely menu - excellent flavour combinations. We had the egg, salmon, scallop and quail. Great wine list as well. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Overall a great evening
We had a delightful dinner here. Very friendly staff and delicious authentic food. We enjoyed it so much we returned a second time during our stay in Siem Reap. Highly recommend. Cash only

review_data.review_title: Travellers to Dubai , especially from India , must go to Gazebo for fine dining .
review_data.review: This fine restaurant is located on a wide street in Bur Dubai, so parking is really not a problem . I went out for dinner with the family, and found our choice to be good, given the restaurant's excellent decor and ambience . Although Gazebo predominantly serves non vegetarian dishes , it is a vegetarians' delight as well, with prompt and courteous service . A bit expensive , but recommended all the same, for a fine gastronomic experience .

Superb. Marvelous. Amazing. I'm running out of words to describe the experience. Especially the Egg coffee & the "uber-special" service by Hien. Such a sweet little girl. Will charm you with conversation everytime. Brighten up the whole place.

review_data.review_title: Delicious food. Excellent value. Get the Passion Fruit Margarita!
review_data.review: Delicious food. Super friendly. The BEST Passion Fruit Margarita I’ve ever had! Lovely atmosphere. Excellent value.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Ask for Jenny!
review_data.review: Great food. Very friendly. Lots of choice. Nice atmosphere with a mix of locals and tourists. We got a walk in table no problem.

...what a Pizza. Being Italian I love pizza but it is not always easy to find good ones abroad. This one is really a great pizza and if you have not problem in spending a little bit more than for a regular one go for it.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: The waiter Ekene served us so well! Fantastic location with fantastic food. We'll be back again. Smooth background music

review_data.review_title: Orange Tiramisu, need I say more?
review_data.review: We tried this on the off chance after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor, the menu has 4 choices per course and we will be returning to try the other two, our first choices were so good.  The service is excellent (prompt but not fussy and service always from the right), the food arrives promptly, beautifully plated (scallion and chilli flowers are very cute) and an appropriate portion size. We had three courses and were full but not struggling to finish.  There is a good range of drinks to accompany the meal and the coffee is excellent, which was a pleasant surprise throughout SR, on our first trip here. This is a training school and we were near the end of their year, which could affect quality at other times but we honestly could not fault it.

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Outstanding customer service and excellent food
review_data.review: The warm welcome, cool beers and excellent food kept us coming back to Takieng every night of our two-week stay at the Renaissance Resort & Spa. All of the staff - Sam, Amp, Will, Puen, Ness and Paul - went out of their way make our experience enjoyable and learn our preferences in terms of level of spiciness. We liked to sit outside with the ocean view so they provided an ice bucket to keep our Singha beers cold. The extensive menu meant we never ate the same main course twice, though we always chose the same shared mixed starters. The Valentine's Day Meal was a particular triumph with an amazing variety of meat, vegetables and seafood, including lobster.  I was also lucky enough to be able to eat here for breakfast on a couple of mornings when they opened up as the hotel was very full. The Chef's Signature Eggs on smashed avocado, tomato salsa and sour dough served to the table with a fresh fruit smoothie and sparkling wine made a heavenly start to the day. I was quite upset when this stopped and I had to return to the busy hotel buffet.  Be sure to make a reservation for dinner as we saw several people turned away as they didn't have space. Thank you Takieng for a five-star dining experience every night of our stay. x

Takieng is our favourite restaurant when we visit the Renaissance Phuket hotel. We love eating out under the stars every night with the sound of the waves crashing on the shore. Service is excellent from start to finish with a shout out to Mama, Fern, Boom, Ammi and all the lovely team who ensured our beer bucket was kept topped up, our favourite table or nearest one was available, and a supply of crispy crackers and dipping sauce started each meal. We enjoyed sampling some of the signature dishes of locally sourced food -Andaman prawns with sea grapes became my favourite starter. Main course portions were very generous. The chef’s willingness to substitute duck for beef in a Mussiman curry and to tone down the heat on some of the spicier dishes was much appreciated. The Valentine’s Meal this year was especially tasty

Wonderful cafe we found on our walk back from Charles bridge. It was quiet and quaint - The perfect sidewalk cafe. Excellent spirits and food at a reasonable price. Very attentive and multilingual staff.

I read the reviews and was still a bot skeptical, but count me as a believer. We had a lovely multi-course meal with wine pairings that was both creative and well-presented. Very warm and friendly service. Yes, you don't have a say here as to the food presented, but it is well worth the risk and detour. We intended to go to Montmartre anyway, and this is just a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. Heartily recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: This is not only a great dinner but a great experience. We were all Americans with one local Argentine but the conversation flowed as freely as the wine. Great to meet with and share life stories with other expats in Buenos Aires. Lots of interesting people. As for the meal, we started with a welcoming cocktail : Vodka, Hesperedina, Jengibre, Aji Amarillo, Jugos de Naranja y Durazno. The six course meal included Pan Integral Casero (a roasted eggplant dish), Berenjena Asada, caldo de Guanciale con Cinco Porotos (an excellent soup), Risoto Negro de Sepia, Adobo de Chancho (the star of the show in my view — a roasted pork dish that was best pork I have had), and finishing with Cheesecake de Especias (a homemade cheesecake with a tangerine topping(delicious). Each course was terrific and accompanying by well matched wines. The star in wine for me was the Desquiciado Garnacha 2021. Thank you so much everyone for a magical evening.

review_data.review_title: Terrific Dinner in St Germain de Pres
review_data.review: Terrific set meal with wine pairings. Didn't realize they specialized in caviar -- and haven't like it before -- but one of the dishes in the meal had it and it was the first time I enjoyed it. Service was excellent and meal very enjoyable with a nice mix of dishes. Highly recommend.

A Michelin star restaurant in the wonderful Bristol Hotel Paris and a romantic location for fine dining in elegant and chic surroundings. However this is not a stuffy and overly formal dining experience but is contemporarily styled with some left of field options as well as some traditional old favorites. The amuse bouche of warm lobster was a stella beginning to a fabulous evening with lovely pink champagne and moving on to a delightful Provencal rosé. Dessert was heavenly as was the aged Calvados to finish of perfect evening. Staff were knowledgeable about each dish and very helpful, indeed they welcomed the opportunity to discuss the menu in detail. So price wise its one of those places where if you need to know how much it will cost you can't afford it. Price however should not be a barrier to enjoying a wonderful evening in delightful surroundings. After all what price can you put on a memory that you will never forget?

review_data.review_title: Wonderful dinner, nice location and setting
review_data.review: Had a fantastic meal in this very convenient and beautiful restaurant right on 5th avenue, located above a Tommy Bahama retail store. Impeccable, attentive service from the waitstaff who frequently asking if we needed anything and refilled our water glasses as we needed it. Very nice plump coconut shrimps for appetizer and very much enjoyed the halibut special with quinoa and one of the margarita special drinks while my wife enjoyed a well prepared filet with garlic potatoes and greens. The warm bread with a cinamon and ginger butter spread was a nice touch. Offered a nice selection of delicious looking desserts but at that point were too full to partake. A gifted singer entertained us with music selection from the 60's through 80's. Nice evening spent after a long day hiking around the city. After leaving the restaurant, bought a few items from the retail clothing store located downstairs.

After looking for some great Vietnamese food we found Era in the old quarter of Hanoi. The restaurant was full even at 830 pm and after a 15min wait we got ourselves a table. The staffs are very polite and welcoming. Generally vietnamese are very kind, polite and helpful. We started with some of the waitress recommendations; spring rolls, Pho with beef, lotus wrapped minced beef and some grilled chicken.  The food came very prompt and with beautiful garnish on the sides. The spring rolls were very fresh, the beef pho was very refreshing and the lotus leaves wrapped beef tasted fantastically.  We ended with some desserts and coffee and we had an overall great experience.  The price and the quality of the food are worthwhile for the wait and the visit.

review_data.review: Complimentary champagne on arrival for our celebration - thank you!  We went for the a la carte - 2 starters (carpaccio and soup), 3 mains (duck, rabbit and lamb chop & shoulder) and 1 dessert (white chocolate).. for 2 of us.. we couldn't decide between 2 mains so got 3!  All of the food was great -especially the duck, so highly recommend this dish. Being in Czech Republic we wanted to try a Czech wine. A very different wine and not what we'd normally choose, but it did grow on me! Our waiter (light haired middle-aged guy - sorry I've forgotten his name!) was faultless. The service from all staff was fantastic. Very attentive and even offering other wine free of charge when we weren't keen on the Czech!  Thank you again for a wonderful evening! I would highly recommend Blue Wagon. Fantastic food, great service and great value for money!
